data.name: Website Audit Fixes
data.body: <p><strong>*PM Note: Open this task if the client has given approval for at least partial fixes if not all.*<br /><br />Goal:</strong> Fix all issues uncovered in the Technical Audit by the Frontend team to improve website search visibility.</p> <strong>Deliverable(s):</strong> <ol> <li>If no dev space exists, create one accordingly. <a href="https://docs.google.com/document/d/1GFHG_ROhHhG45TscOBGkE6db1d_sVsLHLOT7wUmzz-Y/edit#bookmark=id.hni6yo7fe1yx" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">Follow best practices from here</a>.</li> <li>Breakdown of which tasks have been completed and questions/comments on those skipped.</li> </ol> <strong>Checklist:</strong> <ol> <li>All points from website fixes have been responded to accordingly</li> </ol> <a href="https://docs.google.com/document/d/1GFHG_ROhHhG45TscOBGkE6db1d_sVsLHLOT7wUmzz-Y/edit#heading=h.42if8ygppblz" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">Frontend Developer’s Instructions &amp; Guidelines</a><br /><br /><strong>Please perform all fixes on dev site first, once approved by PM, we will push them live.</strong><br /><br />When the audit fixes go live, we should be checking to make sure everything is set up and working correctly on the live site by using the checklist below:<br /><br /> <p><strong>Checklist:</strong></p> <ol> <li>New website can be restored at anytime via the backup file.</li> <li>Website loads on the proper domain - including all its elements such as images, javascript, etc. Use checker tools and also navigate through the site as a user.</li> <li>All page redirects are properly configured &amp; working as per [Workbook: Redirects] including www/non-www [Workbook: Website Plan - Onsite SEO - URL]</li> <li>No 3xx/4xx links on the site</li> <li>No references to dev server (links, images, css, js)</li> <li>Make sure robots.txt isn’t blocking crawlers</li> <li>Make sure pages aren’t noindex (if set via CMS)</li> <li>Contact form testing</li> <li>Advanced functionality/3rd party testing</li> <li>Enable cache and gzip</li> <li>Run page speed test to make sure it loads in &lt;2 seconds</li> <li>Make sure analytics are on all pages</li> <li><strong>implement redirects</strong></li> </ol>

data.name: WP Website Maintenance *O*
data.body: <p>Please log relevant maintenance updates and questions in this task.</p> <h2>Checklist On FED:</h2> <p>One-Time (when opening this task, before MAINT label is added):</p> <ol> <li> <p>Check and list any inactive plugins and themes on the website, and provide the list to the PM to confirm with the client which of them can be removed. <a href="https://www.godaddy.com/resources/skills/remove-wordpress-themes-plugins" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">Why Should Inactive Plugins/Themes Be Removed?</a></p> </li> <li> <p>Check and screenshot all WP users (showing active and inactive users), and provide that to the PM to confirm with the client which of them can be removed.  <a href="https://wpactivitylog.com/inactive-users-wordpress/" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">Why Should Inactive or Spam Users Be Removed?</a></p> </li> <li> <p>Install the Wordfence plugin and set it up for the maintenance@ email to get the security notifications.</p> </li> <li> <p>Check all access (WP-admin, Cpanel/Hosting) for the website and confirm they are all working.</p> </li> <li> <p>Create/Setup monthly maintenance reports to go to the listed client email(s).</p> </li> <li> <p>Backups: Install the WP Backup plugin and set it up to take website backups every 15 days. (NOTE : For websites using git, the backup plugin is not needed as we can use the git repo to restore the backups from the git version control.)</p> </li> </ol> <p> </p> <p>Recurring Checklist for ongoing maintenance:</p> <ol> <li> <p>Monitor the Wordfence security notification emails and if any issues are found, fix them immediately. (Daily)</p> </li> <li> <p>Plugins/WP Core Update (Check weekly, and update within 15 days after local test was successful)</p> </li> <li> <p>Security Check (Weekly)</p> </li> <li> <p>Visual Site Inspections (Weekly)</p> </li> </ol> <p>It includes the frontend parts of the website:<br />- Visual appearance of the web pages</p> <p>- Responsiveness (for mobile, tablet, laptop and large screen) </p> <p>- Browser compatibility:<br />On mobile - Check on android (chrome) and iPhone (both chrome and safari)<br />On desktop - Check on Chrome, Safari and Firefox for computers</p> <p>- Uneven or broken images (not what was intended in the theme layout)</p> <p>- Broken pages/ layouts </p> <p>- Formatting or alignment issues</p> <p><br />5. Check for any potential spam WP users and inform the PM if any are found (Weekly)</p> <p> </p> <p>6. Test all Forms on the site and make sure the client is receiving them as well (every two weeks)</p> <p> </p> <p>7. Check the WP Backup plugin to make sure a website backup is taken every 15 days. (every two weeks)</p> <p> </p> <p>8. Database Cleanup (Monthly)</p> <p>a. Remove Unapproved comments</p> <p>b. Remove Trashed posts</p> <p>c. Remove Auto-draft posts</p> <p>d. Remove Spam Comments</p> <p>e. Delete Post Revisions</p> <p>f. Delete Unused Plugins and Themes</p> <p>g. Remove/Disable Pingbacks and trackbacks<br />h. Remove unwanted Post and comment metadata<br /><br /></p> <p>9. Test Products (WooCommerce sites only) (Monthly)</p> <ol> <li> <p>Create a test Product/Coupon</p> </li> <li> <p>Add product to cart functionality</p> </li> <li> <p>Update the cart functionality</p> </li> <li> <p>Proceed to the checkout page</p> </li> <li> <p>On the final Checkout page (Check if the website has any tax/shipping calculating options, and if so confirm it is working fine)</p> </li> <li> <p>Test all payment options</p> </li> </ol> <h2>On PM:</h2> <ol> <li> <p>Before opening this task, please fill in the proper GForm (i.e. (Re)Start, Website Launch, PM Transfer, etc.) that adds the relevant maintenance details to <a href="https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/u/2/d/19SDNRqoOmsifVDtslETR-M5l7HbCAjwRIJtkZ4i4yMo/edit?usp=sharing" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">Website Maintenance Master Sheet</a></p> </li> <li> <p>Provide WP admin access as well as hosting access to FED</p> </li> <li> <p>Once provided by FED, share the list of inactive WP plugins/themes with the client and confirm which ones can be deleted.</p> </li> <li> <p>Once provided by FED, share the list of WP users with the client and confirm which ones can be deleted.</p> </li> </ol>

data.name: Content Implementation ($Month)
data.body: <p><strong>Goal</strong>: Implement SEO content onto the live site or dev site as indicated by the PM. This task is to be used when a full month of SEO content has been approved by the client and is ready for implementation the website.<br /><br /><strong>Deliverables on PM:<br /></strong>1. Provide content to FED (attachments, links, etc)<br />2. If photos are needed, please provide (attachments, adobe stock links, etc)<br />3. Indicate the location of where the content is to be added (blog, industries, locations, etc) via the link or specific location.<br />4. Specify live site or dev site.<br /><br /></p> <p>On <span class="mention mention-user">Frontend Dev Team</span><br /><strong>Checklist:</strong><br />1. Content is implemented on the website in the correct location with the correct content and applicable photos</p> <div class="rich_text">2. Onsite SEO descriptions have been added to each page via the Yoast SEO plugin.<br />3. All newly added pages have been indexed by default.</div> <p>**Please duplicate this task and swap out the month and feel free to add additional details in the task if needed*</p>

data.name: website changes
data.body: <p><span class="mention mention-user">Frontend Dev Team</span> the client wants to make some changes on the website, as follows:</p> <ol> <li>Please see PDF with how the menu should change, please also see the notes at the top from the client, in the same document.</li> <li> the table shows the site structure as the client wants it, with all the subpages that should go in the menu, in which order and all the details. Some pages don't exist yet, for those pages we should duplicate the layouts from existing pages (client shared that info with us in the table) and then later we will replace photos and text.</li> </ol> <p> </p> <p>Please see notes from the client here, additionally:</p> <div> <blockquote> <div>Here are the first changes for your team to make. Please reach out with any questions you have. The first changes are simply restructuring the Menu Bar, its drop-down menus, and the items that appear in those drop-downs. It also involves linking those drop-down items to the pages (templates) I want—some of which are not the pages they currently link to.</div> <div> </div> <div>The UI changes are very minimal right now: renaming a new Menu Bar items and drop-down items, as well as getting rid of the little ^ that appears in the menu bar.</div> <div> </div> <div>These two documents should explain it clearly (I hope)!</div> </blockquote> </div> <p> </p> <p>If you guys have any questions let me know. Thank you!</p>

data.name: Dev Edits
data.body: <p>1) We could not find social media handles for the site to include in the footer section. Please provide us with the respective social media URL of the client</p> <p><strong> The client is providing them. </strong></p> <p> </p> <p>2) Please provide us contact email for the client to also include in the footer currently it is Lorem Ipsum's email.  <strong>office@blackforestfloors.com</strong></p> <p>  </p> <p><strong>About Us Page:</strong></p> <p> 3) Currently, the text in “About Black Forest” is still lorem ipsum. Please provide us with text to replace it with. <strong>You can use ChatGPT to fill in any missing content. </strong></p> <p> </p> <p>4) The profile cards of team members currently link to nowhere since there are no pages on the site for individual team members. Please mention if we should redirect them elsewhere or remove the empty redirects. <strong>Please hide this section. </strong></p> <p> </p> <p><strong>Areas We Serve Page:</strong></p> <p> 5) We have used a dummy video in the services section. Please provide us with the actual video link/file.  <strong>Use a photo and remove the video. </strong></p> <p> </p> <p><strong>Gallery Page:</strong></p> <p>6) In the Flooring section, we have adjusted the images and gallery as per the new design provided in comment #7. As there are 7 flooring categories being showcased currently but as discussed in task <a href="https://login.smartsites.com/projects/5836/tasks/308595" data-entity-type="Task" data-entity-id="308595">#94: Gallery Page</a> comment #11 it was discussed to keep all 9 categories. Please confirm if we should keep all 9 categories or if just 7 for now is enough. Also please provide us instructions for which image goes for respective flooring showcases in the respective section. <strong>Please keep all 9 categories.</strong> </p> <p> </p> <p>7) Please confirm where the “See More” Button should redirect to in the Flooring Showcase section.<strong> You can remove this CTA. </strong></p> <p> </p> <p> </p> <p><strong>Please make sure all the links are correct. </strong></p> <p> </p>

data.name: Titles, H1s &amp; Meta Descriptions
data.body: <p><strong><span style="text-decoration: underline">When to open this task:</span><span style="text-decoration: none">  </span></strong></p> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">AFTER the Website Plan has been completed [see important considerations]  </span><span style="text-decoration: none"><br /><br /></span></p> <p><strong><span style="text-decoration: underline">Goal</span></strong><span style="text-decoration: none"><strong>:</strong> </span><span style="text-decoration: none"><br /></span><span style="text-decoration: none">Fill in onsite SEO for approved Website Plan. This should include:</span></p> <ul> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Target Keyword: filled for non-Company pages. Otherwise, “N/A”.</span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Header, Titles &amp; URLs &amp; Meta descriptions filled in for all of the pages</span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Features Target Keyword whenever applicable </span></p> </li> </ul> <p><strong> </strong></p> <p><strong><span style="text-decoration: underline">Important Considerations: </span></strong></p> <ol> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">This is by far &amp; away the most important task in our SEO process. </span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">This deliverable can be overwhelming for clients to review/approve. If the client has over 40 pages to check, consider:</span></p> <ul> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Breaking it down into specific rows/groups of pages to have client review in order of importance. </span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Moving Onsite SEO to a separate spreadsheet to isolate/hide the extra distracting columns. </span></p> </li> </ul> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">To avoid delay opening this task, you can begin with only “existing pages” or only batches of pages which have been approved by client. </span><span style="text-decoration: none">It is better to write &amp; implement 10 pages than write but not implement 1000. </span></p> </li> </ol> <p><span style="text-decoration: none"><br /></span><strong><span style="text-decoration: underline">Instructions: </span><span style="text-decoration: none"> </span></strong><span style="text-decoration: none"><br /><br /></span></p> <p><strong><span style="text-decoration: none">On <span class="mention mention-user">Inbound Marketing Team</span>  [1/2]: </span></strong></p> <ol> <li><span style="text-decoration: none">Enter the list of all indexable pages along with their current onsite SEO in the website plan tab.</span> <ul> <li><span style="text-decoration: none">URL, Target Keyword (SV + KWD), Additional Keywords, Old H1 , Old Title, Old Metas</span></li> </ul> </li> <li><span style="text-decoration: none">Confirm all pages are listed in the website plan and organized per our template structure</span><span style="text-decoration: none">. </span></li> <li><span style="text-decoration: none">Highlight any cells where Titles, H1s &amp; Meta descriptions are indicated as missing, duplicate or long in the Technical Audit. (G43-G45)</span></li> <li>Write New Headers and Titles. If the existing headers and titles include the optimized target keywords, are relevant, and follow SEO best practices, there is no need to re-write. Simply write “keep” in the “New” column. <ul> <li>Reassign to Content Team to check/write meta descriptions.</li> </ul> </li> </ol> <br /> <p><strong><span style="text-decoration: none">On  <span class="mention mention-user">Content Team</span>:</span></strong></p> <ol> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Proofread headers &amp; titles for grammar/syntax, and rewrite as needed.</span><span style="text-decoration: none">  </span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Review the existing meta descriptions. If they include the indicated target keywords, are relevant and </span><a href="https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1ZSQ5NbFo_cG4cXzPIKnurIAo71jBR6jFUcrz9iYREw4/edit?gid=2006941339#gid=2006941339" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"><span style="text-decoration: underline">follow SEO best practices</span></a><span style="text-decoration: none">, there is no need to re-write, simply write “keep” in the “New Meta Description” column. </span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">If it needs to be written or re-written, please write meta descriptions, including the target keyword.</span></p> </li> </ol> <p><span style="text-decoration: none"> </span></p> <p><strong><span style="text-decoration: none">On PM [1/2]:</span></strong></p> <ol> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Please review and share with the client. data.name: Mobile Speed Optimization *O*
data.body: <span style="text-decoration: underline"><strong>When to open this task: </strong></span><br /> <ul> <li><span style="text-decoration: none">AFTER Website Audit fixes </span></li> <li><span style="text-decoration: none">IF additional page speed optimizations are still needed</span><span style="text-decoration: none"><br /><br /></span></li> </ul> <p><strong><span style="text-decoration: underline">Goal: </span></strong><span style="text-decoration: none"><strong> </strong>To optimize the mobile page speed issues</span></p> <p><strong> </strong></p> <p><strong><span style="text-decoration: underline">Instructions:</span><span style="text-decoration: none">  </span></strong></p> <p> </p> <p><strong> <span style="text-decoration: none">On <span class="mention mention-user">Frontend Dev Team</span>  [1:2]</span></strong></p> <ol> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Please always do these points:</span></p> <ul> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Unload third-party resources on mobile.</span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Optimize the images, videos, compressing them and implementing caching.</span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Separate image size for mobile and desktop by using image srcset </span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Use responsive image offered by WordPress (Image srcset)</span></p> </li> </ul> </li> </ol> <p><strong><span style="text-decoration: none">On PM </span></strong></p> <ol> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Review the pagespeed after Frontend’s optimizations. If further improvements are still desired, changes to content is required. Please advise the following, and reassign to Frontend Dev. </span></p> <ol> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Confirm if it's okay to use different content on desktop and mobile.</span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">If yes to point 1, please indicate which content should show up ONLY on desktop and not on mobile (Consult with client if needed). If mobile is more than 2 or 2.5 folds, we would suggest omitting any less important content.</span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Please advise If we should add Lazy load resources/sections below the second fold.</span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">If we should have a different design layout for mobile, open up a mobile design mockup task for the homepage and any other complex/very important pages, i.e. if you have a complex design layout, for example if it has a lot of elements, sections and/or dynamic parts.</span></p> </li> </ol> </li> </ol> <p><strong> </strong></p> <p><strong><span style="text-decoration: none">On <span class="mention mention-user">Frontend Dev Team</span> [2:2]</span></strong><span style="text-decoration: none"><br /></span><span style="text-decoration: none">Upon PM approval (see below list) please do:</span></p> <ol> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Separate Mobile content (Such as Image, videos according to viewport size. )</span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Remove unnecessary blocks/ sections on mobile</span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Implement Lazy loading</span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Implement a separate Design Layout that supports mobile page speed.</span></p> </li> </ol> <p><span style="text-decoration: underline"><strong>When to Close:</strong> </span><span style="text-decoration: none">Once optimal page speed is achieved, or we exhausted all efforts within the limitations.</span><span style="text-decoration: none"><br /></span></p> <p> </p> <p><span style="text-decoration: underline"><strong>Link to Manual:</strong></span> <a href="https://docs.google.com/document/d/1Da2PcJZ_pCLqTdQIiUTECN5tYshVaQdA84Vr9WSNiOk/edit#heading=h.5suyzgindjtf" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">https://docs.google.com/document/d/1Da2PcJZ_pCLqTdQIiUTECN5tYshVaQdA84Vr9WSNiOk/edit#heading=h.5suyzgindjtf</a></p>

data.name: Mobile Speed Optimization *O*
data.body: <p><strong>Mobile Speed Optimization *O*</strong></p> <br /> <p><strong>Goal:</strong><span style="font-weight: 400;"> To optimize the mobile page speed issues</span></p> <p> </p> <p><strong>On FED:</strong></p> <p><strong>Please always do these points:</strong></p> <p><span style="font-weight: 400;">- Unload third-party resources on mobile.</span></p> <p><span style="font-weight: 400;">- Optimize the images, videos, compressing them and implementing caching.</span></p> <p><span style="font-weight: 400;">- Separate image size for mobile and desktop by using image srcset </span></p> <p><span style="font-weight: 400;">-Use responsive image offered by WordPress (Image srcset)</span></p> <br /> <p> </p> <p><strong>Upon PM approval (see below list) please do:</strong></p> <ol> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">Separate Mobile content (Such as Image, videos according to viewport size. )</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">Remove unnecessary blocks/ sections on mobile</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">Implement Lazy loading</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">Implement separate Design Layout that supports mobile page speed.</span></li> </ol> <br /> <p><strong>On PM to advise:</strong></p> <ol> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">Please confirm if it's okay to use different content on desktop and mobile.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">If yes to point 1, please indicate which content should show up ONLY on desktop and not on mobile (Consult with client if needed). If mobile is more than 2 or 2.5 folds, we would suggest omitting any less important content.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">Please advise If we should add Lazy load resources/sections below the second fold.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">If we should have a different design layout for mobile, open up a mobile design mockup task for the homepage and any other complex/very important pages, i.e. if you have a complex design layout, for example if it has a lot of elements, sections and/or dynamic parts.</span></li> </ol>

data.name: add/update Creative Arts Therapy program page
data.body: <p>hi <span class="mention mention-user">Frontend Dev Team</span> the client would like to update the <a href="https://www.lukincenter.com/therapeutic-creative-arts-camp/" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"><strong>Creative Arts Therapy Program</strong> Page Content</a></p> <p>so that once you click the <strong>Therapeutic Creative Arts Camp button</strong> just before the Meet Our Passionate Experts section - AND- on the <strong>Group Therapy Page</strong> (<a href="https://www.lukincenter.com/who-we-treat/groups/" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">https://www.lukincenter.com/who-we-treat/groups/</a>).</p> <p> </p> <p class="MsoNormal"><strong>Therapeutic Creative Arts Camp</strong></p> <p class="MsoNormal"><strong>- Lauren Bomberg, Licensed Professional Counselor &amp; Board Certified Movement Psychotherapist </strong></p> <p class="MsoNormal"><strong>- Courtney Medina, Licensed Professional Counselor &amp; Board Certified Art Therapist </strong></p> <p class="MsoNormal"> </p> <p class="MsoNormal">Join us for a week-long morning camp playfully exploring emotions, self-image, social and communication, and coping skills. We are offering a condensed, fun-filled therapeutic experience outside of the busy school schedule to create connections as we kick-off and close-out summer!  </p> <p class="MsoNormal"> </p> <p class="MsoNormal"><strong>WHO: </strong>Children Ages 9-12</p> <p class="MsoNormal"><strong>WHEN: </strong>Monday-Friday 9:00am-1:00pm the Week of June 23 or August 18, 2025</p> <p class="MsoNormal"><strong>WHERE: </strong>Lukin Center of Chatham, 97 Main St, Ste 201</p> <p class="MsoNormal"><strong> </strong></p> <p class="MsoNormal">Lauren Bomberg, LPC, BC-DMT and Courtney Medina, LPC, LPAT, ATR-BC are licensed psychotherapists and creative arts therapists that specialize in serving children inclusive of those with social-emotional, neurodevelopmental, and behavioral challenges.</p> <p class="MsoNormal"> </p> <p class="MsoNormal"><span>Pleae update on Dev </span></p>

data.body: <span style="text-decoration: underline"><strong>When to open this task: </strong></span><br /> <ul> <li><span style="text-decoration: none">AFTER Website Audit fixes </span></li> <li><span style="text-decoration: none">IF additional page speed optimizations are still needed</span><span style="text-decoration: none"><br /><br /></span></li> </ul> <p><strong><span style="text-decoration: underline">Goal: </span></strong><span style="text-decoration: none"><strong> </strong>To optimize the mobile page speed issues</span></p> <p><strong> </strong></p> <p><strong><span style="text-decoration: underline">Instructions:</span><span style="text-decoration: none">  </span></strong></p> <p> </p> <p><strong> <span style="text-decoration: none">On <span class="mention mention-user">Frontend Dev Team</span>  [1:2]</span></strong></p> <ol> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Please always do these points:</span></p> <ul> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Unload third-party resources on mobile.</span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Optimize the images, videos, compressing them and implementing caching.</span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Separate image size for mobile and desktop by using image srcset </span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Use responsive image offered by WordPress (Image srcset)</span></p> </li> </ul> </li> </ol> <p><strong><span style="text-decoration: none">On PM </span></strong></p> <ol> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Review the pagespeed after Frontend’s optimizations. If further improvements are still desired, changes to content is required. Please advise the following, and reassign to Frontend Dev. </span></p> <ol> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Confirm if it's okay to use different content on desktop and mobile.</span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">If yes to point 1, please indicate which content should show up ONLY on desktop and not on mobile (Consult with client if needed). If mobile is more than 2 or 2.5 folds, we would suggest omitting any less important content.</span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Please advise If we should add Lazy load resources/sections below the second fold.</span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">If we should have a different design layout for mobile, open up a mobile design mockup task for the homepage and any other complex/very important pages, i.e. if you have a complex design layout, for example if it has a lot of elements, sections and/or dynamic parts.</span></p> </li> </ol> </li> </ol> <p><strong> </strong></p> <p><strong><span style="text-decoration: none">On <span class="mention mention-user">Frontend Dev Team</span> [2:2]</span></strong><span style="text-decoration: none"><br /></span><span style="text-decoration: none">Upon PM approval (see below list) please do:</span></p> <ol> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Separate Mobile content (Such as Image, videos according to viewport size. )</span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Remove unnecessary blocks/ sections on mobile</span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Implement Lazy loading</span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Implement a separate Design Layout that supports mobile page speed.</span></p> </li> </ol> <p><span style="text-decoration: underline"><strong>When to Close:</strong> </span><span style="text-decoration: none">Once optimal page speed is achieved, or we exhausted all efforts within the limitations.</span><span style="text-decoration: none"><br /></span></p> <p> </p> <p><span style="text-decoration: underline"><strong>Link to Manual:</strong></span> <a href="https://docs.google.com/document/d/1Da2PcJZ_pCLqTdQIiUTECN5tYshVaQdA84Vr9WSNiOk/edit#heading=h.5suyzgindjtf" target="_blank" rel="noopener data.name: Titles, H1s &amp; Meta Descriptions
data.body: <p><strong><span style="text-decoration: underline">When to open this task:</span><span style="text-decoration: none">  </span></strong></p> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">AFTER the Website Plan has been completed [see important considerations]  </span><span style="text-decoration: none"><br /><br /></span></p> <p><strong><span style="text-decoration: underline">Goal</span></strong><span style="text-decoration: none"><strong>:</strong> </span><span style="text-decoration: none"><br /></span><span style="text-decoration: none">Fill in onsite SEO for approved Website Plan. This should include:</span></p> <ul> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Target Keyword: filled for non-Company pages. Otherwise, “N/A”.</span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Header, Titles &amp; URLs &amp; Meta descriptions filled in for all of the pages</span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Features Target Keyword whenever applicable </span></p> </li> </ul> <p><strong> </strong></p> <p><strong><span style="text-decoration: underline">Important Considerations: </span></strong></p> <ol> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">This is by far &amp; away the most important task in our SEO process. </span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">This deliverable can be overwhelming for clients to review/approve. If the client has over 40 pages to check, consider:</span></p> <ul> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Breaking it down into specific rows/groups of pages to have client review in order of importance. </span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Moving Onsite SEO to a separate spreadsheet to isolate/hide the extra distracting columns. </span></p> </li> </ul> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">To avoid delay opening this task, you can begin with only “existing pages” or only batches of pages which have been approved by client. </span><span style="text-decoration: none">It is better to write &amp; implement 10 pages than write but not implement 1000. </span></p> </li> </ol> <p><span style="text-decoration: none"><br /></span><strong><span style="text-decoration: underline">Instructions: </span><span style="text-decoration: none"> </span></strong><span style="text-decoration: none"><br /><br /></span></p> <p><strong><span style="text-decoration: none">On <span class="mention mention-user">Inbound Marketing Team</span>  [1/2]: </span></strong></p> <ol> <li><span style="text-decoration: none">Enter the list of all indexable pages along with their current onsite SEO in the website plan tab.</span> <ul> <li><span style="text-decoration: none">URL, Target Keyword (SV + KWD), Additional Keywords, Old H1 , Old Title, Old Metas</span></li> </ul> </li> <li><span style="text-decoration: none">Confirm all pages are listed in the website plan and organized per our template structure</span><span style="text-decoration: none">. </span></li> <li><span style="text-decoration: none">Highlight any cells where Titles, H1s &amp; Meta descriptions are indicated as missing, duplicate or long in the Technical Audit. (G43-G45)</span></li> <li>Write New Headers and Titles. If the existing headers and titles include the optimized target keywords, are relevant, and follow SEO best practices, there is no need to re-write. Simply write “keep” in the “New” column. <ul> <li>Reassign to Content Team to check/write meta descriptions.</li> </ul> </li> </ol> <br /> <p><strong><span style="text-decoration: none">On  <span class="mention mention-user">Content Team</span>:</span></strong></p> <ol> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Proofread headers &amp; titles for grammar/syntax, and rewrite as needed.</span><span style="text-decoration: none">  </span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Review the existing meta descriptions. If they include the indicated target keywords, are relevant and </span><a href="https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1ZSQ5NbFo_cG4cXzPIKnurIAo71jBR6jFUcrz9iYREw4/edit?gid=2006941339#gid=2006941339" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"><span style="text-decoration: underline">follow SEO best practices</span></a><span style="text-decoration: none">, there is no need to re-write, simply write “keep” in the “New Meta Description” column. </span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">If it needs to be written or re-written, please write meta descriptions, including the target keyword.</span></p> </li> </ol> <p><span style="text-decoration: none"> </span></p> <p><strong><span style="text-decoration: none">On PM [1/2]:</span></strong></p> <ol> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Please review and share with the client. [See important considerations &amp;<a href="https://docs.google.com/document/d/1xxp9t8Z80MM5Slq7jHPaXc1fsEylaRDOPlv_ykPowNg/edit" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"> email template</a>]</span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">After getting approval, please re-assign to FED to implement.</span></p> </li> </ol> <strong><span style="text-decoration: none"><br />On <span class="mention mention-user">Frontend Dev Team</span> </span></strong><br /> <ol> <li>Please implement approved Titles, H1s &amp; Meta Descriptions, ensuring that this does not impact other website elements like site navigation.  <ul> <li>Target keyword</li> <li>Title</li> <li>Header</li> <li>Meta description</li> </ul> </li> </ol> <br /><strong><span style="text-decoration: none">On <span class="mention mention-user">Inbound Marketing Team</span> [2/2]:<br /></span></strong> <ol> <li>Please confirm proper implementation of Titles, H1s &amp; Meta Descriptions by pulling missing/duplicate/ titles, headers, and meta description data from Screaming Frog. <ul> <li>Issues regarding ‘noindex’ pages or pages otherwise unimportant for SEO (eg. paginated pages, legal/admin pages, etc.) can be ignored.</li> <li>If any issues appear in the crawl but data is not available in the workbook, please request it from the PM. </li> </ul> </li> </ol> <p><strong> </strong></p> <p><strong>On PM [2/2]: </strong></p> <ol> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">If all Titles, H1s &amp; Meta Descriptions has been implemented, proceed to close the task. </span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">If we only completed the first batch or ScreamingFrog still shows issues, repeat writing, approval, and implementation as needed until all descriptions are published. </span></p> </li> </ol> <p><strong> </strong></p> <p><strong><span style="text-decoration: underline">When to Close:</span></strong><span style="text-decoration: none"> </span><span style="text-decoration: none"><br /></span><span style="text-decoration: none">Once all optimized H1s, Titles &amp; Meta descriptions have been implemented &amp; Screaming Frog confirms no Onsite SEO issues on </span><span style="text-decoration: none"><strong>indexable</strong> </span><span style="text-decoration: none">pages. </span></p> <p><span style="text-decoration: none"> </span></p> <p><span style="text-decoration: underline"><strong>Link to Manual:</strong></span> <a href="https://docs.google.com/document/d/1Da2PcJZ_pCLqTdQIiUTECN5tYshVaQdA84Vr9WSNiOk/edit#heading=h.10gdsc5qm8im" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">https://docs.google.com/document/d/1Da2PcJZ_pCLqTdQIiUTECN5tYshVaQdA84Vr9WSNiOk/edit#heading=h.10gdsc5qm8im</a></p>

data.name: Mobile Speed Optimization *O*
data.body: <p><strong>Mobile Speed Optimization *O*</strong></p> <br /> <p><strong>Goal:</strong><span> To optimize the mobile page speed issues</span></p> <p> </p> <p><strong>On FED:</strong></p> <p><strong>Please always do these points:</strong></p> <p><span>- Unload third-party resources on mobile.</span></p> <p><span>- Optimize the images, videos, compressing them and implementing caching.</span></p> <p><span>- Separate image size for mobile and desktop by using image srcset </span></p> <p><span>-Use responsive image offered by WordPress (Image srcset)</span></p> <br /> <p> </p> <p><strong>Upon PM approval (see below list) please do:</strong></p> <ol> <li><span>Separate Mobile content (Such as Image, videos according to viewport size. )</span></li> <li><span>Remove unnecessary blocks/ sections on mobile</span></li> <li><span>Implement Lazy loading</span></li> <li><span>Implement separate Design Layout that supports mobile page speed.</span></li> </ol> <br /> <p><strong>On PM to advise:</strong></p> <ol> <li><span>Please confirm if it's okay to use different content on desktop and mobile.</span></li> <li><span>If yes to point 1, please indicate which content should show up ONLY on desktop and not on mobile (Consult with client if needed). If mobile is more than 2 or 2.5 folds, we would suggest omitting any less important content.</span></li> <li><span>Please advise If we should add Lazy load resources/sections below the second fold.</span></li> <li><span>If we should have a different design layout for mobile, open up a mobile design mockup task for the homepage and any other complex/very important pages, i.e. if you have a complex design layout, for example if it has a lot of elements, sections and/or dynamic parts.</span></li> </ol>

data.name: Moving Hosting to T35
data.body: <p><span class="mention mention-user">Frontend Dev Team</span> We need to move hosting to T35 by next week due to the client losing hosting from previous agency on March 31. Attached below is the cPanel backup files. I have also attached the website operations manual the previous agency provided. Please let me know if you have everything you need to proceed. </p> <p> <br /><span> Here’s a temporary link to access them:</span><span> </span><a href="https://eu.onetimesecret.com/secret/1xcytyg9er09cu6b09o7ybkzsb0x2aw" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">https://eu.onetimesecret.com/secret/1xcytyg9er09cu6b09o7ybkzsb0x2aw</a><span> </span><span> </span><strong>(you will only see this once) Please make sure you save the information somewhere. </strong></p> <p> </p> <p><span>You can download your backup here if needed: </span><a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1Wf7t_NUfgsW1qHmlJkjHzd94KRDu6jfi/view?usp=sharing" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">https://drive.google.com/file/d/1Wf7t_NUfgsW1qHmlJkjHzd94KRDu6jfi/view?usp=sharing</a></p>

data.name: Form Testing &amp; SMTP
data.body: <div class="rich_text"> <p><span style="text-decoration: underline"><strong>When to Open: <br /></strong></span><span style="text-decoration: none">AFTER the Website Tracking task is completed<br /></span><span style="text-decoration: none">REOPEN IF changes are made to forms or new forms are introduced</span></p> <p><span></span></p> <p> </p> <p><strong><span style="text-decoration: underline">Goal:</span> E</strong>nsure proper sending, receipt &amp; conversion tracking for all forms on the website.</p> <p> </p> <p><span style="text-decoration: underline"><strong>Instructions: </strong></span></p> <p><strong>On <span class="mention mention-user">Frontend Dev Team</span> </strong></p> <ol> <li>List of all separate forms on the website (duplicate occurrences of the same form are not needed) including fields and recipient email address(es). Make sure this matches with the form recipient per the Workbook. </li> <li>Send a test submission on each form to the client’s recipient email and a test FED email. Confirm receipt  of email in FED email with screenshot &amp; check with PM that client has also received on their end.</li> <li>Check that the form submission conversion event is recorded correctly.  </li> </ol> <br /> <p><strong>On PM</strong></p> <ol> <li>Confirm form fields and receipt of test email with client. </li> <li>If there are no issues, this task can be closed. </li> <li>If the client cannot receive the test form submissions, acquire SMTP email logins &amp; assign them to FED to implement SMTP. (2FA should be disabled) </li> <li>If the form is not properly tracked as a conversion event (and should be) please open or re-open the Website Tracking task.</li> </ol> <br /> <p><strong>IF initial form testing was not successful, on <span class="mention mention-user">Frontend Dev Team</span>:</strong></p> <ol> <li>Setup SMTP, or if SMTP is not possible, setup client email to use as sender/receiver.</li> <li>Resend test email. Confirm receipt from client &amp; recheck conversion tracking. </li> </ol> <br /> <p>List of Extensions:</p> <p>Wordpress, WP Mail SMTP by WPForms: <a href="https://wordpress.org/plugins/wp-mail-smtp/" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">https://wordpress.org/plugins/wp-mail-smtp/</a></p> <p>Magento 2, Magento 2 SMTP Extension (MagePal): <a href="https://github.com/magepal/magento2-gmail-smtp-app" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">https://github.com/magepal/magento2-gmail-smtp-app</a></p> <br /> <p><span style="text-decoration: underline"><strong>When to close the task: </strong></span></p> <p>When the client has confirmed receipt of form submissions to the correct email address. </p> <p> </p> <p><span style="text-decoration: underline">Link to Manual:</span> <a href="https://docs.google.com/document/d/1Da2PcJZ_pCLqTdQIiUTECN5tYshVaQdA84Vr9WSNiOk/edit#heading=h.mzc21w80hle5" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">https://docs.google.com/document/d/1Da2PcJZ_pCLqTdQIiUTECN5tYshVaQdA84Vr9WSNiOk/edit#heading=h.mzc21w80hle5</a></p> <p><br /><span style="text-decoration: underline">Link to Tutorial: </span>TBD</p> </div>

data.name: Internal Linking
data.body: <p><strong>Goal: </strong>Optimize internal linking and increase page authority for important target pages. </p> <p> </p> <p><strong>When to Open This Task:</strong></p> <ul> <li>During Onboarding <strong>AFTER </strong>Client has confirmed top pages and most valuable target keywords. This should be confirmed during Keyword Research task + SEO Brief. </li> <li>During campaign<strong><em> </em></strong><strong>IF/WHEN</strong> new important pages are added, or if you want to increase authority of a specific page or set of pages on the site. </li> <li>During a campaign <strong>IF</strong> you notice a blog or webpage which is getting lots of impressions and no clicks to increase internal authority and reinforce target  <br />keywords</li> </ul> <p> </p> <p><strong>Important Notes/Considerations</strong></p> <ul> <li>This task is a great use for monthly link building hours, however, it can take considerable time for mapping keywords &amp; implementation. It also varies depending on the size of the website &amp; page content. Therefore, it’s recommended to keep a close eye hours for this task and request estimates from IBM &amp; FED if needed. <br /><br /></li> </ul> <p><strong>Billable? </strong>Yes, hours should be billed under monthly link building task.<br /><br /><strong>On PM</strong><strong><em> </em></strong></p> <ol> <li>Indicate the pages &amp; target keyword(s) you’d link to check for interlinking opportunities. For basic interlinking, begin with the ‘Top Pages’ from SEO Brief.</li> <li>Confirm keywords optimized for <a href="https://backlinko.com/hub/seo/search-intent" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">search intent</a> &amp; achievable <a href="https://www.searchenginejournal.com/keyword-competition/313815/" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">search volume/difficulty ratio</a> have been selected for those target pages.</li> </ol> <p><br /><strong>On IBM</strong> </p> <ol> <li> Search client’s site for internal link opportunities. Include pages where the target anchor text already exists, and opportunities to insert it with suggestions. <a href="https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1gjat_CXBCUOy1_Ulk3v1Z-K3Oz4aVAKYOON7DAmkX5g/edit#gid=0" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">Example deliverable.  </a></li> <li>Reassign to PM to check. </li> </ol> <p><br /><strong><em>On CON *O*</em></strong></p> <ol> <li><em>If requested by PM, check IBM’s suggestions for anchor text replacement for grammar &amp; syntax.  (If time is pressing, this can be done by PM) </em></li> </ol> <p><strong><br />On FED </strong></p> <ol> <li>Once approved by PM, implement links + anchor text per approved keyword sheet.</li> <li>*O* If requested by PM, provide crawl results showing anchor text for target pages. </li> </ol> <p><br /><strong>Final Deliverables: </strong>Internal pages pointing toward target pages with optimized anchor text. </p> <p><br /><strong>When to close task: </strong>When PM confirms pages have been interlinked as requested. </p>

data.name: Connect Social Media Accounts to Website
data.body: <p><strong>Goal: </strong>Add social icons and link social media pages on the client’s website as well as any public listings that we can. </p> <p> </p> <p><span><strong>Adding Links to the Website</strong></span></p> <p> </p> <p><strong>On PM for FED</strong></p> <ol> <li>Make sure we have access to clients website</li> <li>Tell FED where you would like the links on the site (footer or at the top is common)</li> <li>Provide FED with all platforms and profile links that need added<br /><br /></li> </ol> <p><strong>On FED: </strong></p> <ol> <li>Add all social links indicated by the social media manager to the clients website.</li> <li>Reassign back to the social media manager </li> </ol> <p><strong>Adding Links to Listings</strong></p> <p> </p> <p><strong>On PM for IBM</strong></p> <ol> <li>Make sure we have access the clients Google My Business listing and ask for Yelp logins if they have it</li> <li>Provide IBM with all platforms &amp; profile links that need added<br /><br /></li> </ol> <p><strong>On IBM: </strong></p> <ol> <li>Add all social links indicated by the social media manager to the clients GMB listing</li> <li>Identify any other live, public listings, including Yelp that we can add the social media links to and proceed with adding all social links to these listings</li> </ol>

Confirm receipt from client &amp; recheck conversion tracking. </li> </ol> <br /> <p>List of Extensions:</p> <p>Wordpress, WP Mail SMTP by WPForms: <a href="https://wordpress.org/plugins/wp-mail-smtp/" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">https://wordpress.org/plugins/wp-mail-smtp/</a></p> <p>Magento 2, Magento 2 SMTP Extension (MagePal): <a href="https://github.com/magepal/magento2-gmail-smtp-app" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">https://github.com/magepal/magento2-gmail-smtp-app</a></p> <br /> <p><span style="text-decoration: underline"><strong>When to close the task: </strong></span></p> <p>When the client has confirmed receipt of form submissions to the correct email address. </p> <p> </p> <p><span style="text-decoration: underline">Link to Manual:</span> <a href="https://docs.google.com/document/d/1Da2PcJZ_pCLqTdQIiUTECN5tYshVaQdA84Vr9WSNiOk/edit#heading=h.mzc21w80hle5" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">https://docs.google.com/document/d/1Da2PcJZ_pCLqTdQIiUTECN5tYshVaQdA84Vr9WSNiOk/edit#heading=h.mzc21w80hle5</a></p> <p><br /><span style="text-decoration: underline">Link to Tutorial: </span>TBD</p> </div>

data.name: Titles, H1s &amp; Meta Descriptions
data.body: <p><strong><span style="text-decoration: underline">When to open this task:</span><span style="text-decoration: none">  </span></strong></p> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">AFTER the Website Plan has been completed [see important considerations]  </span><span style="text-decoration: none"><br /><br /></span></p> <p><strong><span style="text-decoration: underline">Goal</span></strong><span style="text-decoration: none"><strong>:</strong> </span><span style="text-decoration: none"><br /></span><span style="text-decoration: none">Fill in onsite SEO for approved Website Plan. This should include:</span></p> <ul> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Target Keyword: filled for non-Company pages. Otherwise, “N/A”.</span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Header, Titles &amp; URLs &amp; Meta descriptions filled in for all of the pages</span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Features Target Keyword whenever applicable </span></p> </li> </ul> <p><strong> </strong></p> <p><strong><span style="text-decoration: underline">Important Considerations: </span></strong></p> <ol> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">This is by far &amp; away the most important task in our SEO process. </span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">This deliverable can be overwhelming for clients to review/approve. If the client has over 40 pages to check, consider:</span></p> <ul> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Breaking it down into specific rows/groups of pages to have client review in order of importance. </span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Moving Onsite SEO to a separate spreadsheet to isolate/hide the extra distracting columns. </span></p> </li> </ul> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">To avoid delay opening this task, you can begin with only “existing pages” or only batches of pages which have been approved by client. </span><span style="text-decoration: none">It is better to write &amp; implement 10 pages than write but not implement 1000. </span></p> </li> </ol> <p><span style="text-decoration: none"><br /></span><strong><span style="text-decoration: underline">Instructions: </span><span style="text-decoration: none"> </span></strong><span style="text-decoration: none"><br /><br /></span></p> <p><strong><span style="text-decoration: none">On <span class="mention mention-user">Inbound Marketing Team</span>  [1/2]: </span></strong></p> <ol> <li><span style="text-decoration: none">Enter the list of all indexable pages along with their current onsite SEO in the website plan tab.</span> <ul> <li><span style="text-decoration: none">URL, Target Keyword (SV + KWD), Additional Keywords, Old H1 , Old Title, Old Metas</span></li> </ul> </li> <li><span style="text-decoration: none">Confirm all pages are listed in the website plan and organized per our template structure</span><span style="text-decoration: none">. </span></li> <li><span style="text-decoration: none">Highlight any cells where Titles, H1s &amp; Meta descriptions are indicated as missing, duplicate or long in the Technical Audit. (G43-G45)</span></li> <li>Write New Headers and Titles. If the existing headers and titles include the optimized target keywords, are relevant, and follow SEO best practices, there is no need to re-write. Simply write “keep” in the “New” column. <ul> <li>Reassign to Content Team to check/write meta descriptions.</li> </ul> </li> </ol> <br /> <p><strong><span style="text-decoration: none">On  <span class="mention mention-user">Content Team</span>:</span></strong></p> <ol> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Proofread headers &amp; titles for grammar/syntax, and rewrite as needed.</span><span style="text-decoration: none">  </span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Review the existing meta descriptions. If they include the indicated target keywords, are relevant and </span><a href="https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1ZSQ5NbFo_cG4cXzPIKnurIAo71jBR6jFUcrz9iYREw4/edit?gid=2006941339#gid=2006941339" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"><span style="text-decoration: underline">follow SEO best practices</span></a><span style="text-decoration: none">, there is no need to re-write, simply write “keep” in the “New Meta Description” column. </span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">If it needs to be written or re-written, please write meta descriptions, including the target keyword.</span></p> </li> </ol> <p><span style="text-decoration: none"> </span></p> <p><strong><span style="text-decoration: none">On PM [1/2]:</span></strong></p> <ol> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Please review and share with the client. [See important considerations &amp;<a href="https://docs.google.com/document/d/1xxp9t8Z80MM5Slq7jHPaXc1fsEylaRDOPlv_ykPowNg/edit" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"> email template</a>]</span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">After getting approval, please re-assign to FED to implement.</span></p> </li> </ol> <strong><span style="text-decoration: none"><br />On <span class="mention mention-user">Frontend Dev Team</span> </span></strong><br /> <ol> <li>Please implement approved Titles, H1s &amp; Meta Descriptions, ensuring that this does not impact other website elements like site navigation.  <ul> <li>Target keyword</li> <li>Title</li> <li>Header</li> <li>Meta description</li> </ul> </li> </ol> <br /><strong><span style="text-decoration: none">On <span class="mention mention-user">Inbound Marketing Team</span> [2/2]:<br /></span></strong> <ol> <li>Please confirm proper implementation of Titles, H1s &amp; Meta Descriptions by pulling missing/duplicate/ titles, headers, and meta description data from Screaming Frog. <ul> <li>Issues regarding ‘noindex’ pages or pages otherwise unimportant for SEO (eg. paginated pages, legal/admin pages, etc.) can be ignored.</li> <li>If any issues appear in the crawl but data is not available in the workbook, please request it from the PM. </li> </ul> </li> </ol> <p><strong> </strong></p> <p><strong>On PM [2/2]: </strong></p> <ol> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">If all Titles, H1s &amp; Meta Descriptions has been implemented, proceed to close the task. </span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">If we only completed the first batch or ScreamingFrog still shows issues, repeat writing, approval, and implementation as needed until all descriptions are published. </span></p> </li> </ol> <p><strong> </strong></p> <p><strong><span style="text-decoration: underline">When to Close:</span></strong><span style="text-decoration: none"> </span><span style="text-decoration: none"><br /></span><span style="text-decoration: none">Once all optimized H1s, Titles &amp; Meta descriptions have been implemented &amp; Screaming Frog confirms no Onsite SEO issues on </span><span style="text-decoration: none"><strong>indexable</strong> </span><span style="text-decoration: none">pages. </span></p> <p><span style="text-decoration: none"> </span></p> <p><span style="text-decoration: underline"><strong>Link to Manual:</strong></span> <a href="https://docs.google.com/document/d/1Da2PcJZ_pCLqTdQIiUTECN5tYshVaQdA84Vr9WSNiOk/edit#heading=h.10gdsc5qm8im" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">https://docs.google.com/document/d/1Da2PcJZ_pCLqTdQIiUTECN5tYshVaQdA84Vr9WSNiOk/edit#heading=h.10gdsc5qm8im</a></p>

data.name: Mobile Speed Optimization *O*
data.body: <span style="text-decoration: underline"><strong>When to open this task: </strong></span><br /> <ul> <li><span style="text-decoration: none">AFTER Website Audit fixes </span></li> <li><span style="text-decoration: none">IF additional page speed optimizations are still needed</span><span style="text-decoration: none"><br /><br /></span></li> </ul> <p><strong><span style="text-decoration: underline">Goal: </span></strong><span style="text-decoration: none"><strong> </strong>To optimize the mobile page speed issues</span></p> <p><strong> </strong></p> <p><strong><span style="text-decoration: underline">Instructions:</span><span style="text-decoration: none">  </span></strong></p> <p> </p> <p><strong> <span style="text-decoration: none">On <span class="mention mention-user">Frontend Dev Team</span>  [1:2]</span></strong></p> <ol> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Please always do these points:</span></p> <ul> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Unload third-party resources on mobile.</span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Optimize the images, videos, compressing them and implementing caching.</span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Separate image size for mobile and desktop by using image srcset </span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Use responsive image offered by WordPress (Image srcset)</span></p> </li> </ul> </li> </ol> <p><strong><span style="text-decoration: none">On PM </span></strong></p> <ol> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Review the pagespeed after Frontend’s optimizations. If further improvements are still desired, changes to content is required. Please advise the following, and reassign to Frontend Dev. </span></p> <ol> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Confirm if it's okay to use different content on desktop and mobile.</span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">If yes to point 1, please indicate which content should show up ONLY on desktop and not on mobile (Consult with client if needed). If mobile is more than 2 or 2.5 folds, we would suggest omitting any less important content.</span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Please advise If we should add Lazy load resources/sections below the second fold.</span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">If we should have a different design layout for mobile, open up a mobile design mockup task for the homepage and any other complex/very important pages, i.e. if you have a complex design layout, for example if it has a lot of elements, sections and/or dynamic parts.</span></p> </li> </ol> </li> </ol> <p><strong> </strong></p> <p><strong><span style="text-decoration: none">On <span class="mention mention-user">Frontend Dev Team</span> [2:2]</span></strong><span style="text-decoration: none"><br /></span><span style="text-decoration: none">Upon PM approval (see below list) please do:</span></p> <ol> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Separate Mobile content (Such as Image, videos according to viewport size. )</span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Remove unnecessary blocks/ sections on mobile</span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Implement Lazy loading</span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Implement a separate Design Layout that supports mobile page speed.</span></p> </li> </ol> <p><span style="text-decoration: underline"><strong>When to Close:</strong> </span><span style="text-decoration: none">Once optimal page speed is achieved, or we exhausted all efforts within the limitations.</span><span style="text-decoration: none"><br /></span></p> <p> </p> <p><span style="text-decoration: underline"><strong>Link to Manual:</strong></span> <a href="https://docs.google.com/document/d/1Da2PcJZ_pCLqTdQIiUTECN5tYshVaQdA84Vr9WSNiOk/edit#heading=h.5suyzgindjtf" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">https://docs.google.com/document/d/1Da2PcJZ_pCLqTdQIiUTECN5tYshVaQdA84Vr9WSNiOk/edit#heading=h.5suyzgindjtf</a></p>

data.name: Site Backup
data.body: <p><span style="text-decoration: underline"><strong><span style="text-decoration: underline">When to open this task:</span></strong></span><span style="text-decoration: none"><strong> </strong>As soon as we have hosting/cPanel access. <strong>For Shopify</strong>, please close this task right away. </span></p> <div align="left"> <p><br /><span style="text-decoration: underline"><strong>Goal:</strong></span>  Create a backup in case someone goes wrong and we need to revert to the previous website version. We also use the site backup to create a test environment for development.<br /><br /></p> <p><span style="text-decoration: underline"><strong>Instructions:</strong></span><br /><strong>ON PM: </strong></p> <ol> <li> <p>Before assigning this task make sure the site access logins are in the workbook</p> </li> </ol> <br /> <p><strong>On  <span class="mention mention-user">Frontend Dev Team</span> </strong></p> <ol> <li> <p>Link to the backup zip file on GDrive (containing all folders and database SQL)</p> </li> </ol> <br /> <p><span style="text-decoration: underline"><strong>When to Close:</strong></span> When FED shares a link to site backup in Google Drive. </p> <p><br /><strong><span style="text-decoration: underline">Link to Manual:</span></strong> <a href="https://docs.google.com/document/d/1Da2PcJZ_pCLqTdQIiUTECN5tYshVaQdA84Vr9WSNiOk/edit#heading=h.acvi577rfsy0" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"><span style="text-decoration: underline">https://docs.google.com/document/d/1Da2PcJZ_pCLqTdQIiUTECN5tYshVaQdA84Vr9WSNiOk/edit#heading=h.acvi577rfsy0</span></a> </p> <br /> <p><span style="text-decoration: underline"><strong>Link to Tutorial</strong></span><strong>: </strong>TBD</p> </div>

data.name: Configure Development Environment
data.body: <p><span style="text-decoration: underline">Task Description</span></p> <p><span style="text-decoration: underline">When to open this task</span><span style="text-decoration: none">: </span></p> <ul> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">AFTER we have full access to the site (hosting &amp; CMS) </span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">BEFORE doing any dev work on the site</span></p> </li> </ul> <p><span style="text-decoration: none"><br /></span><span style="text-decoration: underline">Goal:</span><span style="text-decoration: none"> </span><span style="text-decoration: none"><br /></span><span style="text-decoration: none">Create a development environment using a copy of their existing site where the website changes &amp; fixes can be tested before moving to the production (live) environment.</span><strong><br /></strong></p> <p> </p> <p><span style="text-decoration: underline">Instructions:</span></p> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">ON PM: </span></p> <ol> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Before assigning this task to Frontend Team, please provide the following:</span></p> <ol> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Provide URL of live domain</span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Specify which CMS it is (i.e. Custom backend, WP, WP+Woocommerce, Magento1, Magento2, etc.) </span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">As we are copying the existing live site on the dev environment, make sure the site access is in the workbook before assigning this task.</span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Inform FED if the client has their own developers so that Collaboration Flow information can be documented internally. </span></p> </li> </ol> </li> </ol> <p><strong> </strong></p> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">On Frontend Dev: </span><span style="text-decoration: none"><br /></span><span style="text-decoration: none"><br /></span><span style="text-decoration: none">If the client is on Wordpress: </span></p> <ol> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Create SmartWebsiteDesign.com Subdomain URL &amp; cPanel </span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Create Git Repo </span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Make sure the dev site  is blocked via robots.txt &amp; is not being tracked with GA.</span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Comment accordingly with the deliverables, and add it to the Workbook [Logins] tab </span></p> <ol> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Disable Pro/Premium plugins on our dev site. </span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Reactivate the Pro &amp; Premium plugins with the proper licensing</span></p> <ol> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">For plugins where Smartsites has unlimited licenses or licenses that can be used for clients  (eg. Gravity form, WP Rocket etc.) please use this license for the dev site </span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">If sharable licenses are not available, please request for the PM/client to provide the plugin licensing details. The client may need to purchase additional licenses to use on the dev site. </span></p> </li> </ol> </li> </ol> </li> </ol> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Note: The purpose of the dev site is to test changes on an environment which is as similar to the client’s live site as possible. Missing plugins licenses may cause inaccuracies in testing, so we strongly advise to address all licensing issues ASAP. </span></p> <p><span style="text-decoration: none"> </span></p> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">If the client is on another CMS: </span></p> <ol> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Follow the CMS-specific guide </span><a href="https://docs.google.com/document/d/16Z8LoUr6jhyHTDkQ9LQfxlIB65J6RlMJ3QWhhTezkvo/edit?tab=t.0" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"><span style="text-decoration: underline">here</span></a><span style="text-decoration: none">. </span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">If the client’s CMS is not already represented in the guide, please research solutions and discuss with the PM. Once a solution is decided, add the procedure to the guide for future reference. </span><span style="text-decoration: none"><br /></span><span style="text-decoration: none"><br /><br /></span></p> </li> </ol> <p><span style="text-decoration: underline">When to Close: </span><span style="text-decoration: underline"><br /></span><span style="text-decoration: none">When development environment is created and logged in the workbook</span></p> <p><span style="text-decoration: underline"><br /></span><span style="text-decoration: underline">Link to Manual: </span><a href="https://docs.google.com/document/d/1Da2PcJZ_pCLqTdQIiUTECN5tYshVaQdA84Vr9WSNiOk/edit#heading=h.7yewl7f6d2fn" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"><span style="text-decoration: underline">https://docs.google.com/document/d/1Da2PcJZ_pCLqTdQIiUTECN5tYshVaQdA84Vr9WSNiOk/edit#heading=h.7yewl7f6d2fn</span></a><span style="text-decoration: none"> </span></p>

data.name: Backlink Health Check
data.body: <h2><strong>When to open this task?</strong></h2> <ul> <li>At the beginning of a campaign</li> <li>Task will auto-spawn quarterly </li> </ul> <h2> </h2> <h2><strong>Billable?</strong></h2> <p>Yes </p> <p> </p> <h2><strong>Important Notes/Considerations:</strong></h2> <p>IndexMeNow is a paid service, so we will only use this for links that are not indexed naturally after 3 months. This task will replace the previous task <strong>Broken Links Check</strong></p> <h2> </h2> <p><strong>Goal:</strong>  Maintain a healthy backlink profile for the client<br /><br /><strong>Instructions:</strong><strong><br /></strong></p> <p><strong>On IBM</strong></p> <ol> <li>Proceed with filling out the broken links tab in the link building sheet &amp; advise next steps. </li> <li>Check for spammy backlinks to disavow &amp; advise next steps. </li> <li>Check for unindexed backlinks. Request Indexing via IndexMeNow if link was created longer than 3 months ago (i.e. since last Backlink Health Check). </li> <li>After the task is complete, update the <a href="https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1X7KV29YXwEZgO0_NbptPXrm1FLGLBP594Oup3__UvAM/edit" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">Master Linkbuilding List</a> with client’s acquired links &amp; <a href="https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1sZ6HVXME7KMM6uVx4gpmv-FkZclvuuy0E07-86QJRAw/edit#gid=1664165067" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">Linkbuilding Blacklist</a> &amp; Greylist with unindexable backlinks.  <br /><br /></li> </ol> <p><strong>On PM</strong></p> <ol> <li>Review the list of broken links. </li> </ol> <ul> <li>For the tabs, broken internal links broken external links, and broken page with backlinks please task this out to the Frontend Team. </li> <li>If there are items found for the Lost Links tab, then task this out to the Inbound Marketing Team to get back.<br /><br /></li> </ul> <p>Review spammy backlink list. Provide IBM feedback or approve to disavow.  Unindexable links will be refunded. Sometimes this is due to  3xx or 4xx issues which can be resolved by finding &amp; resubmitting the correct URL. Troubleshoot with IBM. After a second failed resubmission we will consider the link unindexable and IBM will add to Greylist or Blacklist as appropriate.  <br /><br /><strong>When to close this task (and any next steps)?</strong></p> <ul> <li>Broken Links - FED &amp; IBM will confirm links have been resolved</li> <li>Spammy Links - IBM will provide screenshot of submitted disavow file. Google doesn't provide any further update on disavow submissions but will take care of it, so once submitted there is no further action needed.</li> <li>Unindexed Backlinks - IBM will provide screenshot of indexed backlinks. Refunded backlinks </li> <li>After resolving broken links, spammy backlinks &amp; unindexed backlinks &amp; IBM has updated the  <a href="https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1X7KV29YXwEZgO0_NbptPXrm1FLGLBP594Oup3__UvAM/edit" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">Master Linkbuilding List</a> &amp; <a href="https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1sZ6HVXME7KMM6uVx4gpmv-FkZclvuuy0E07-86QJRAw/edit#gid=1664165067" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">Linkbuilding Blacklist</a></li> </ul>

data.name: Updating Areas We Serve
data.body: <p><span class="mention mention-user">Frontend Dev Team</span> </p> <p>Here is a link to a video I put together explaining what needs to be done with the Areas We Serve section of the site, and attached below is the mp4 file: <a href="https://www.awesomescreenshot.com/video/38126521?key=a612655632ef6b085bde3b9b4a003600" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">https://www.awesomescreenshot.com/video/38126521?key=a612655632ef6b085bde3b9b4a003600</a></p> <p> </p> <p>to briefly summarize, we need the "Areas We Serve" tab removed from the main navigation and added to the footer.</p> <p> </p> <p>On this page we need to remove the "Explore our Reach" section.</p> <p> </p> <p>We also need to remove 3 of the boxes from the top, leaving only 3 tiles, one for:</p> <ol> <li>Northern Virginia</li> <li>Southern Maryland</li> <li>Washington DC</li> </ol> <p>Within these tiles we will have lists of the specific towns/cities that the client services.</p> <p> </p> <p>At the bottom of each title we will remove the phone number and "more info" button, in place of "Contact Us" which directs to the contact form.</p>

data.name: Identify Linkable Assets
data.body: <p><span style="text-decoration: underline">When to open this task: </span></p> <ul> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">AFTER ‘basic’ SEO tasks are completed. (eg, if client is already ranking well for money keywords &amp; has strong domain ranking</span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">IF client is looking for more advanced SEO tactics and the client’s SEO foundation is already strong.  </span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">These strategies can be extremely effective, but usually require design &amp; development hours, so not recommended for clients with minimal SEO hours OR if the client has not completed the basic SEO optimizations.</span></p> </li> </ul> <p><span style="text-decoration: underline">Goal:</span><span style="text-decoration: none"> </span></p> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Identify linkable assets on the website that the inbound marketing team can do outreach/link building to.</span></p> <p><strong> </strong></p> <p><span style="text-decoration: underline">Instructions:</span></p> <p><strong><span style="text-decoration: none">On PM [1:2]: </span></strong></p> <ol> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Brainstorm with the client to identify any items they have or could create that users may find helpful (</span><a href="https://docs.google.com/document/d/1Da2PcJZ_pCLqTdQIiUTECN5tYshVaQdA84Vr9WSNiOk/edit#heading=h.4rt04islxxjx" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"><span style="text-decoration: underline">examples</span></a><span style="text-decoration: none"> by Smatsites) (</span><a href="https://ahrefs.com/blog/linkable-assets/" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"><span style="text-decoration: underline">more examples</span></a><span style="text-decoration: none">) </span></p> <ol> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Guides, ebooks, or tools that can be repurposed for SEO. </span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Proprietary data (eg. research, statistics, or studies) that they can share </span></p> </li> </ol> </li> </ol> <p><strong> </strong></p> <p><strong><span style="text-decoration: none">On <span class="mention mention-user">Inbound Marketing Team</span> </span></strong></p> <ol> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Review the client's site for existing linkable assets. </span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Browse around the current website looking for materials like in-depth guides/ cornerstone content,  helpful graphics/infographics, tools like calculators, (</span><a href="https://ahrefs.com/blog/linkable-assets/" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"><span style="text-decoration: underline">more examples</span></a><span style="text-decoration: none">)</span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">If found, provide data on traffic, rankings &amp; UX as compared to similar assets on the web, and recommend optimizations and suggestions to improve rankings, if required. </span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Browse competitor websites for inspiration/examples. </span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Review competitors ‘top pages’ or ‘pages best by links’ in Ahrefs</span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">See if any of the top linked/trafficked pages are pages that we can model off and suggest those to PM/Client.</span></p> </li> </ol> <p><strong> </strong></p> <p><strong><span style="text-decoration: none">On PM  [2:2]:</span></strong></p> <ol> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Review the findings. </span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">If linkable assets exist already on the site, open a (billable) task to address IBM’s suggested optimizations and/or start an outreach campaign.  </span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">If linkable assets should be created, select the topic and open a (billable)  task to create this. If content is suggested, open Cornerstone Content task. If other asset, open a custom task to describe the goal, and get estimates from the teams. </span></p> </li> </ol> <p> </p> <p><span style="text-decoration: underline">When to close this task (and any next steps)?</span></p> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Once an existing or planned linkable asset has been approved by the client and follow up task has been created. </span></p> <p><strong> </strong></p> <p><span style="text-decoration: underline">Link to Manual: <br /></span><a href="https://docs.google.com/document/d/1Da2PcJZ_pCLqTdQIiUTECN5tYshVaQdA84Vr9WSNiOk/edit#heading=h.qsa4df9xwydk" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">https://docs.google.com/document/d/1Da2PcJZ_pCLqTdQIiUTECN5tYshVaQdA84Vr9WSNiOk/edit#heading=h.qsa4df9xwydk</a></p>

data.name: Add breadcrumbs throughout the website
data.body: <p>hi <span class="mention mention-user">Frontend Dev Team</span> I will be referencing this UI Audit for this update. Word directly to the Live site and please ensure your QA is 100%.  Please see the following design notes: <a href="https://drive.google.com/drive/folders/1-7VmEkiHjup2Je5AqDMFVaTE_De-TDcd" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">https://drive.google.com/drive/folders/1-7VmEkiHjup2Je5AqDMFVaTE_De-TDcd</a></p> <p>Page 9</p> <p> </p> <p>- There is no breadcrumb on the whole website</p> <p>except a few random pages.</p> <p> </p> <p>GUIDELINES</p> <p>Breadcrumbs navigation will greatly enhance how</p> <p>visitors find their way around your website.</p> <p>RECOMMENDATIONS</p> <ul> <li>Add breadcrumbs throughout the website.</li> </ul> <p>Lets target the main pages and serves for now</p> <p> </p> <p><img src="/proxy.php?proxy=forward_thumbnail&module=system&invalidate=aa84d14bc5afe7a0b2b62ad010d476eb151ac7dd&context=upload&name=2025-03%2F146809-5imm6B8D0gr4aC1cQ8WmADWDjKULHMNxtXE3cfXV&original_file_name=image.png&width=500&height=300&ver=391775&scale=scale&crop=1" alt="image.png" image-type="attachment" object-id="258969" /></p>
data.notes: Marked completed by PM

data.name: Client&#039;s site may be compromised
data.body: <p>Hi <span class="mention mention-user">Frontend Dev Team</span> hope you're doing well!</p> <p> </p> <p>I am wondering if this site was recently hacked or has malware, <span>I'm seeing a weird thumbnail and title for the site (attached ss)</span></p> <p><span>but not when I visit the site itself</span></p> <p> </p> <p><span>Can you please check ASAP? Additionally, a user was added to the GSC today as an owner that I don't recognize (</span></p> <p> </p> <p><span>Thank you!</span></p>
data.notes: Reach out to Uma DD, the maintenance task is on her, she might have been cleaning the site. Also ask if we can assign her the task if she is cleaning the malware on maintenance task
