data.name: Website Maintenance - https://thepointeseniorliving.com/
data.body: <p>Please log relevant maintenance updates and questions in this task.</p> <h2>Checklist On FED:</h2> <p>One-Time (when opening this task, before MAINT label is added):</p> <ol> <li> <p>Check and list any inactive plugins and themes on the website, and provide the list to the PM to confirm with the client which of them can be removed.<span style="text-decoration: underline"> </span><a href="https://www.godaddy.com/resources/skills/remove-wordpress-themes-plugins" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"><span style="text-decoration: underline">Why Should Inactive Plugins/Themes Be Removed?</span></a></p> </li> <li> <p>Check and screenshot all WP users (showing active and inactive users), and provide that to the PM to confirm with the client which of them can be removed. <span style="text-decoration: underline"> </span><a href="https://wpactivitylog.com/inactive-users-wordpress/" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"><span style="text-decoration: underline">Why Should Inactive or Spam Users Be Removed?</span></a></p> </li> <li> <p>Install the Wordfence plugin and set it up for the maintenance@ email to get the security notifications.</p> </li> <li> <p>Check all access (WP-admin, Cpanel/Hosting) for the website and confirm they are all working.</p> </li> <li> <p>Create/Setup monthly maintenance reports to go to the listed client email(s).</p> </li> <li> <p>Backups: Install the WP Backup plugin and set it up to take website backups every 15 days.</p> </li> </ol> <p> </p> <p>Recurring Checklist for ongoing maintenance:</p> <ol> <li> <p>Monitor the Wordfence security notification emails and if any issues are found, fix them immediately. (Daily)</p> </li> <li> <p>Plugins/WP Core Update (Check weekly, and update within 15 days after local test was successful)</p> </li> <li> <p>Security Check (Weekly)</p> </li> <li> <p>Visual Site Inspections (Weekly)</p> </li> </ol> <p>It includes the frontend parts of the website:<br />- Visual appearance of the web pages</p> <p>- Responsiveness (for mobile, tablet, laptop and large screen) </p> <p>- Browser compatibility: <br />On mobile - Check on android (chrome) and iPhone (both chrome and safari) <br />On desktop - Check on Chrome, Safari and Firefox for computers</p> <p>- Uneven or broken images (not what was intended in the theme layout)</p> <p>- Broken pages/ layouts </p> <p>- Formatting or alignment issues</p> <ol> <li> <p>Check for any potential spam WP users and inform the PM if any are found (Weekly)</p> </li> <li> <p>Test all Forms on the site and make sure the client is receiving them as well (every two weeks)</p> </li> <li> <p>Check the WP Backup plugin to make sure a website backup is taken every 15 days. (every two weeks)</p> </li> <li> <p>Database Cleanup (Monthly)</p> <ol> <li> <p>Remove Unapproved comments</p> </li> <li> <p>Remove Trashed posts</p> </li> <li> <p>Remove Auto-draft posts</p> </li> <li> <p>Remove Spam Comments</p> </li> <li> <p>Delete Post Revisions</p> </li> <li> <p>Delete Unused Plugins and Themes</p> </li> <li> <p>Remove/Disable Pingbacks and trackbacks</p> </li> <li> <p>Remove unwanted Post and comment metadata</p> </li> </ol> </li> </ol> <h2>On PM:</h2> <p> </p> <ol> <li> <p>Before opening this task, please fill in the proper GForm (i.e. (Re)Start, Website Launch, PM Transfer, etc.) that adds the relevant maintenance details to <a href="https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/u/2/d/19SDNRqoOmsifVDtslETR-M5l7HbCAjwRIJtkZ4i4yMo/edit?usp=sharing" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"><span style="text-decoration: underline">Website Maintenance Master Sheet</span></a></p> </li> <li> <p>Provide WP admin access as well as hosting access to FED</p> </li> <li> <p>Once provided by FED, share the list of inactive WP plugins/themes with the client and confirm which ones can be deleted.</p> </li> <li> <p>Once provided by FED, share the list of WP users with the client and confirm which ones can be deleted.</p> </li> </ol>

data.name: Configure Development Environment
data.body: <p><span style="text-decoration: underline">Task Description</span></p> <p><span style="text-decoration: underline">When to open this task</span><span style="text-decoration: none">: </span></p> <ul> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">AFTER we have full access to the site (hosting &amp; CMS) </span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">BEFORE doing any dev work on the site</span></p> </li> </ul> <p><span style="text-decoration: none"><br /></span><span style="text-decoration: underline">Goal:</span><span style="text-decoration: none"> </span><span style="text-decoration: none"><br /></span><span style="text-decoration: none">Create a development environment using a copy of their existing site where the website changes &amp; fixes can be tested before moving to the production (live) environment.</span><strong><br /></strong></p> <p> </p> <p><span style="text-decoration: underline">Instructions:</span></p> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">ON PM: </span></p> <ol> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Before assigning this task to Frontend Team, please provide the following:</span></p> <ol> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Provide URL of live domain</span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Specify which CMS it is (i.e. Custom backend, WP, WP+Woocommerce, Magento1, Magento2, etc.) </span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">As we are copying the existing live site on the dev environment, make sure the site access is in the workbook before assigning this task.</span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Inform FED if the client has their own developers so that Collaboration Flow information can be documented internally. </span></p> </li> </ol> </li> </ol> <p><strong> </strong></p> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">On Frontend Dev: </span><span style="text-decoration: none"><br /></span><span style="text-decoration: none"><br /></span><span style="text-decoration: none">If the client is on Wordpress: </span></p> <ol> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Create SmartWebsiteDesign.com Subdomain URL &amp; cPanel </span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Create Git Repo </span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Make sure the dev site  is blocked via robots.txt &amp; is not being tracked with GA.</span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Comment accordingly with the deliverables, and add it to the Workbook [Logins] tab </span></p> <ol> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Disable Pro/Premium plugins on our dev site. </span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Reactivate the Pro &amp; Premium plugins with the proper licensing</span></p> <ol> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">For plugins where Smartsites has unlimited licenses or licenses that can be used for clients  (eg. Gravity form, WP Rocket etc.) please use this license for the dev site </span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">If sharable licenses are not available, please request for the PM/client to provide the plugin licensing details. The client may need to purchase additional licenses to use on the dev site. </span></p> </li> </ol> </li> </ol> </li> </ol> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Note: The purpose of the dev site is to test changes on an environment which is as similar to the client’s live site as possible. Missing plugins licenses may cause inaccuracies in testing, so we strongly advise to address all licensing issues ASAP. </span></p> <p><span style="text-decoration: none"> </span></p> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">If the client is on another CMS: </span></p> <ol> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Follow the CMS-specific guide </span><a href="https://docs.google.com/document/d/16Z8LoUr6jhyHTDkQ9LQfxlIB65J6RlMJ3QWhhTezkvo/edit?tab=t.0" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"><span style="text-decoration: underline">here</span></a><span style="text-decoration: none">. </span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">If the client’s CMS is not already represented in the guide, please research solutions and discuss with the PM. Once a solution is decided, add the procedure to the guide for future reference. </span><span style="text-decoration: none"><br /></span><span style="text-decoration: none"><br /><br /></span></p> </li> </ol> <p><span style="text-decoration: underline">When to Close: </span><span style="text-decoration: underline"><br /></span><span style="text-decoration: none">When development environment is created and logged in the workbook</span></p> <p><span style="text-decoration: underline"><br /></span><span style="text-decoration: underline">Link to Manual: </span><a href="https://docs.google.com/document/d/1Da2PcJZ_pCLqTdQIiUTECN5tYshVaQdA84Vr9WSNiOk/edit#heading=h.7yewl7f6d2fn" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"><span style="text-decoration: underline">https://docs.google.com/document/d/1Da2PcJZ_pCLqTdQIiUTECN5tYshVaQdA84Vr9WSNiOk/edit#heading=h.7yewl7f6d2fn</span></a><span style="text-decoration: none"> </span></p>

data.body: <p><strong><span style="text-decoration: underline">When to open this task:</span><span style="text-decoration: none">  </span></strong></p> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">AFTER the Website Plan has been completed [see important considerations]  </span><span style="text-decoration: none"><br /><br /></span></p> <p><strong><span style="text-decoration: underline">Goal</span></strong><span style="text-decoration: none"><strong>:</strong> </span><span style="text-decoration: none"><br /></span><span style="text-decoration: none">Fill in onsite SEO for approved Website Plan. This should include:</span></p> <ul> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Target Keyword: filled for non-Company pages. Otherwise, “N/A”.</span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Header, Titles &amp; URLs &amp; Meta descriptions filled in for all of the pages</span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Features Target Keyword whenever applicable </span></p> </li> </ul> <p><strong> </strong></p> <p><strong><span style="text-decoration: underline">Important Considerations: </span></strong></p> <ol> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">This is by far &amp; away the most important task in our SEO process. </span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">This deliverable can be overwhelming for clients to review/approve. If the client has over 40 pages to check, consider:</span></p> <ul> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Breaking it down into specific rows/groups of pages to have client review in order of importance. </span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Moving Onsite SEO to a separate spreadsheet to isolate/hide the extra distracting columns. </span></p> </li> </ul> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">To avoid delay opening this task, you can begin with only “existing pages” or only batches of pages which have been approved by client. </span><span style="text-decoration: none">It is better to write &amp; implement 10 pages than write but not implement 1000. </span></p> </li> </ol> <p><span style="text-decoration: none"><br /></span><strong><span style="text-decoration: underline">Instructions: </span><span style="text-decoration: none"> </span></strong><span style="text-decoration: none"><br /><br /></span></p> <p><strong><span style="text-decoration: none">On <span class="mention mention-user">Inbound Marketing Team</span>  [1/2]: </span></strong></p> <ol> <li><span style="text-decoration: none">Enter the list of all indexable pages along with their current onsite SEO in the website plan tab.</span> <ul> <li><span style="text-decoration: none">URL, Target Keyword (SV + KWD), Additional Keywords, Old H1 , Old Title, Old Metas</span></li> </ul> </li> <li><span style="text-decoration: none">Confirm all pages are listed in the website plan and organized per our template structure</span><span style="text-decoration: none">. </span></li> <li><span style="text-decoration: none">Highlight any cells where Titles, H1s &amp; Meta descriptions are indicated as missing, duplicate or long in the Technical Audit. (G43-G45)</span></li> <li>Write New Headers and Titles. If the existing headers and titles include the optimized target keywords, are relevant, and follow SEO best practices, there is no need to re-write. Simply write “keep” in the “New” column. <ul> <li>Reassign to Content Team to check/write meta descriptions.</li> </ul> </li> </ol> <br /> <p><strong><span style="text-decoration: none">On  <span class="mention mention-user">Content Team</span>:</span></strong></p> <ol> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Proofread headers &amp; titles for grammar/syntax, and rewrite as needed.</span><span style="text-decoration: none">  </span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Review the existing meta descriptions. If they include the indicated target keywords, are relevant and </span><a href="https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1ZSQ5NbFo_cG4cXzPIKnurIAo71jBR6jFUcrz9iYREw4/edit?gid=2006941339#gid=2006941339" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"><span style="text-decoration: underline">follow SEO best practices</span></a><span style="text-decoration: none">, there is no need to re-write, simply write “keep” in the “New Meta Description” column. </span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">If it needs to be written or re-written, please write meta descriptions, including the target keyword.</span></p> </li> </ol> <p><span style="text-decoration: none"> </span></p> <p><strong><span style="text-decoration: none">On PM [1/2]:</span></strong></p> <ol> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Please review and share with the client. [See important considerations &amp;<a href="https://docs.google.com/document/d/1xxp9t8Z80MM5Slq7jHPaXc1fsEylaRDOPlv_ykPowNg/edit" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"> email template</a>]</span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">After getting approval, please re-assign to FED to implement.</span></p> </li> </ol> <strong><span style="text-decoration: none"><br />On <span class="mention mention-user">Frontend Dev Team</span> </span></strong><br /> <ol> <li>Please implement approved Titles, H1s &amp; Meta Descriptions, ensuring that this does not impact other website elements like site navigation.  <ul> <li>Target keyword</li> <li>Title</li> <li>Header</li> <li>Meta description</li> </ul> </li> </ol> <br /><strong><span style="text-decoration: none">On <span class="mention mention-user">Inbound Marketing Team</span> [2/2]:<br /></span></strong> <ol> <li>Please confirm proper implementation of Titles, H1s &amp; Meta Descriptions by pulling missing/duplicate/ titles, headers, and meta description data from Screaming Frog. <ul> <li>Issues regarding ‘noindex’ pages or pages otherwise unimportant for SEO (eg. paginated pages, legal/admin pages, etc.) can be ignored.</li> <li>If any issues appear in the crawl but data is not available in the workbook, please request it from the PM. </li> </ul> </li> </ol> <p><strong> </strong></p> <p><strong>On PM [2/2]: </strong></p> <ol> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">If all Titles, H1s &amp; Meta Descriptions has been implemented, proceed to close the task. </span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">If we only completed the first batch or ScreamingFrog still shows issues, repeat writing, approval, and implementation as needed until all descriptions are published. </span></p> </li> </ol> <p><strong> </strong></p> <p><strong><span style="text-decoration: underline">When to Close:</span></strong><span style="text-decoration: none"> </span><span style="text-decoration: none"><br /></span><span style="text-decoration: none">Once all optimized H1s, Titles &amp; Meta descriptions have been implemented &amp; Screaming Frog confirms no Onsite SEO issues on </span><span style="text-decoration: none"><strong>indexable</strong> </span><span style="text-decoration: none">pages. </span></p> <p><span style="text-decoration: none"> </span></p> <p><span style="text-decoration: underline"><strong>Link to Manual:</strong></span> <a href="https://docs.google.com/document/d/1Da2PcJZ_pCLqTdQIiUTECN5tYshVaQdA84Vr9WSNiOk/edit#heading=h.10gdsc5qm8im" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">https://docs.google.com/document/d/1Da2PcJZ_pCLqTdQIiUTECN5tYshVaQdA84Vr9WSNiOk/edit#heading=h.10gdsc5qm8im</a></p>

data.due_change_reason: We reviewed the indexing status and found that the URL has not been indexed yet. Therefore, we've set the due date for March 17th to monitor the indexing progress.

data.name: Malware Cleaning *O*
data.body: <h1>On OMs</h1> <p>Please scan the site with multiple tools to check the site for malware and clean any malicious activity. Once done please also check GSC to ensure no security issues are appearing on that end either.</p> <br /> <p><strong>Checklist for FED</strong></p> <br /> <ol> <li>Clean the malware using the guide (<a href="https://github.com/smart-sites/developer-guides/blob/master/malware-cleanup.md" target="_blank" rel="noreferrer noopener">https://github.com/smart-sites/developer-guides/blob/master/malware-cleanup.md</a>).</li> </ol> <p>1.1. Attach any reports of the tools from pt. 1 you used.</p> <ol> <li>Launch GSC security check (it will take some time).</li> </ol> <p>2.1 Launch any  specific checks that were mentioned in the task and were not done in pt. 1</p> <ol> <li>Review cron jobs.</li> <li>Review CMS admin/employee users.</li> <li>Change CMS passwords for all admin/employee users. Update in WB.</li> <li>Change hosting passwords (cpanel/FTP/etc). Update in WB.</li> </ol> <br /> <p><strong>Checklist for BED (in case the hosting is t35)</strong></p> <br /> <ol> <li>Review SSH keys.</li> <li>Reset all running processes for the account.</li> </ol> <br /> <p><strong>Notes on the checklist</strong></p> <br /> <ol> <li>All points should be commented on the task. I.e. You removed some entity, changed password, or need to confirm the suspicious entity - comment everything for the client to know and future reference.</li> </ol> <br /> <ol> <li><em>Review entity</em> means </li> </ol> <ol> <li>Remove the malware entity</li> <li>List all other records for the client to confirm.</li> </ol> <br /><br /> <h1>On PM</h1> <p>Please list the website URL as well as any concerns/indicators as to why there might be malware on the site and assign this task to FED.</p> <br /> <p><em>Notes to PM: </em></p> <ul> <li>Always use the high priority checkbox + 24hour label for the initial phase of this task.</li> </ul> <ul> <li><em>Issues will not get fixed in search results right away after the malware is cleaned, this will need to be reviewed from Google’s end. Usually GSC reviews the websites after submitting within 48 hrs, however, sometimes they take longer, and we can not control it from our end, since it is the process of the Google Services.</em></li> </ul>
data.notes: WP password changed | Consult with Bidur sir

data.name: Content Implementation ($Month)
data.body: <strong>Goal</strong>: Implement SEO content onto the live site or dev site as indicated by the PM. This task is to be used when a full month of SEO content has been approved by the client and is ready for implementation the website.<br /><br /><strong>Deliverables on PM:<br /></strong>1. Provide content to FED (attachments, links, etc)<br />2. If photos are needed, please provide (attachments, adobe stock links, etc)<br />3. Indicate the location of where the content is to be added (blog, industries, locations, etc) via the link or specific location.<br />4. Specify live site or dev site.<br /><br /><strong>Checklist:</strong><br />1. Content is implemented on the website in the correct location with the correct content and applicable photos<br /><br />**Please duplicate this task and swap out the month and feel free to add additional details in the task if needed*

data.name: Content Implementation ($Month)
data.body: <p><strong><span style="text-decoration: underline">When to open this task:</span></strong><span style="text-decoration: underline"><br /></span><span style="text-decoration: none">When a full month of SEO content has been sent to  the client  and is ready for implementation on the website.</span></p> <p><span style="text-decoration: none"><br /></span><strong><span style="text-decoration: underline">Goal:</span></strong><span style="text-decoration: none"> </span><span style="text-decoration: none"><br /></span><span style="text-decoration: none">Implement SEO content onto the live site or dev site as indicated by the PM. </span></p> <p><strong> </strong></p> <p><strong><span style="text-decoration: underline">Instructions:</span></strong><span style="text-decoration: underline"><br /></span><span style="text-decoration: underline"><br /></span><strong><span style="text-decoration: none">On PM:</span></strong></p> <ol> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Duplicate this task, &amp; customize the task name with the correct Month &amp; Year.</span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Provide the required information for FED </span></p> <ol> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Content: [Link to approved content, or indicated “attached”]</span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Photos: [Link to approved photos or indicated “attached”]</span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Page Details: </span></p> <ul> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">For web pages, indicate the row of the website plan to reference for Onsite SEO &amp; url structure </span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">For blogs, indicate the row of the Ed. Calendar to check for blog category. </span></p> </li> </ul> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Specify whether pages should be scheduled, added to live, added as drafts, or created on dev.* </span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Inbound Internal Links to create: [Indicate if any pages should be added the website navigation structure, or linked to from any existing page (eg. When adding a service page, it may be logical to add a link from the “all services” splash page) </span></p> </li> </ol> </li> </ol> <p><span style="text-decoration: none"><br /></span><span style="text-decoration: none">*<span style="text-decoration: underline">NOTE:</span> Not recommended to create pages on dev unless this is a brand new page template. If clients wants approval, draft mode is much better. See </span><a href="https://docs.google.com/document/d/16Z8LoUr6jhyHTDkQ9LQfxlIB65J6RlMJ3QWhhTezkvo/edit" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"><span style="text-decoration: underline">Dev Site Changes Guid</span></a><span style="text-decoration: none">e for more details. </span></p> <p><strong> </strong></p> <p><strong><span style="text-decoration: none">On <span class="mention mention-user">Frontend Dev Team</span> </span></strong></p> <ol> <li><span style="text-decoration: none">Implement content on the website in the correct location with the correct photos &amp; and onsite SEO. </span></li> <li>Ensure new content is implemented per [Workbook | Content Implementation QA] <a href="https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1E2-QnwWv-dmZO2UFxyGIC08EWSF5E0xW8UL7fxO-f1k/edit#gid=0" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">(eg.)</a></li> </ol> <br /> <p><strong><span style="text-decoration: underline">When to Close:</span></strong><span style="text-decoration: none"> </span><span style="text-decoration: none"><br /></span><span style="text-decoration: none">Once the month’s content has been implemented on the site </span><span style="text-decoration: none"><br /></span><span style="text-decoration: none"><br /></span><span style="text-decoration: underline"><strong>Link to Manual:</strong> </span><a href="https://docs.google.com/document/d/1Da2PcJZ_pCLqTdQIiUTECN5tYshVaQdA84Vr9WSNiOk/edit#heading=h.ce3aco68a5j2" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"><span style="text-decoration: underline">https://docs.google.com/document/d/1Da2PcJZ_pCLqTdQIiUTECN5tYshVaQdA84Vr9WSNiOk/edit#heading=h.ce3aco68a5j2</span></a></p>

data.name: Redirects Setup
data.body: <div class="rich_text"> <p><strong>Goal:</strong> Match up each old site webpage URL to a new site URL so users+search are properly redirected.</p> <br /> <p><strong>Deliverable(s):</strong> List of all Old Site URLs (column A) each matched to an equivalent new site URL (column B). [Workbook: Redirects Setup]</p> <br /> <p><strong>Checklist:</strong></p> <p>1. [Workbook: Redirects]</p> <ol> <li>List of Old Site URLs contains all webpages. (column A)</li> <li>New Site URL is completely filled. (column B)</li> <li>New Site URLs are matched to the most logical &amp; relevant pages.</li> </ol> 2. Check and suggest fixes if there are inconsistencies with dev site urls and the page urls outlined in the website plan.<br /><br /> <p><a href="https://docs.google.com/document/d/1GFHG_ROhHhG45TscOBGkE6db1d_sVsLHLOT7wUmzz-Y/edit#bookmark=id.59gk434nu0w3" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">Strategist’s Instructions &amp; Guidelines</a><br /><br /></p> </div>
data.notes: HP

data.name: Configure Development Environment
data.body: <p><span style="text-decoration: underline">Task Description</span></p> <p><span style="text-decoration: underline">When to open this task</span><span style="text-decoration: none">: </span></p> <ul> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">AFTER we have full access to the site (hosting &amp; CMS) </span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">BEFORE doing any dev work on the site</span></p> </li> </ul> <p><span style="text-decoration: none"><br /></span><span style="text-decoration: underline">Goal:</span><span style="text-decoration: none"> </span><span style="text-decoration: none"><br /></span><span style="text-decoration: none">Create a development environment using a copy of their existing site where the website changes &amp; fixes can be tested before moving to the production (live) environment.</span><strong><br /></strong></p> <p> </p> <p><span style="text-decoration: underline">Instructions:</span></p> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">ON PM: </span></p> <ol> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Before assigning this task to Frontend Team, please provide the following:</span></p> <ol> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Provide URL of live domain</span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Specify which CMS it is (i.e. Custom backend, WP, WP+Woocommerce, Magento1, Magento2, etc.) </span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">As we are copying the existing live site on the dev environment, make sure the site access is in the workbook before assigning this task.</span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Inform FED if the client has their own developers so that Collaboration Flow information can be documented internally. </span></p> </li> </ol> </li> </ol> <p><strong> </strong></p> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">On Frontend Dev: </span><span style="text-decoration: none"><br /></span><span style="text-decoration: none"><br /></span><span style="text-decoration: none">If the client is on Wordpress: </span></p> <ol> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Create SmartWebsiteDesign.com Subdomain URL &amp; cPanel </span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Create Git Repo </span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Make sure the dev site  is blocked via robots.txt &amp; is not being tracked with GA.</span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Comment accordingly with the deliverables, and add it to the Workbook [Logins] tab </span></p> <ol> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Disable Pro/Premium plugins on our dev site. </span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Reactivate the Pro &amp; Premium plugins with the proper licensing</span></p> <ol> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">For plugins where Smartsites has unlimited licenses or licenses that can be used for clients  (eg. Gravity form, WP Rocket etc.) please use this license for the dev site </span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">If sharable licenses are not available, please request for the PM/client to provide the plugin licensing details. The client may need to purchase additional licenses to use on the dev site. </span></p> </li> </ol> </li> </ol> </li> </ol> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Note: The purpose of the dev site is to test changes on an environment which is as similar to the client’s live site as possible. Missing plugins licenses may cause inaccuracies in testing, so we strongly advise to address all licensing issues ASAP. </span></p> <p><span style="text-decoration: none"> </span></p> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">If the client is on another CMS: </span></p> <ol> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Follow the CMS-specific guide </span><a href="https://docs.google.com/document/d/16Z8LoUr6jhyHTDkQ9LQfxlIB65J6RlMJ3QWhhTezkvo/edit?tab=t.0" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"><span style="text-decoration: underline">here</span></a><span style="text-decoration: none">. </span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">If the client’s CMS is not already represented in the guide, please research solutions and discuss with the PM. Once a solution is decided, add the procedure to the guide for future reference. </span><span style="text-decoration: none"><br /></span><span style="text-decoration: none"><br /><br /></span></p> </li> </ol> <p><span style="text-decoration: underline">When to Close: </span><span style="text-decoration: underline"><br /></span><span style="text-decoration: none">When development environment is created and logged in the workbook</span></p> <p><span style="text-decoration: underline"><br /></span><span style="text-decoration: underline">Link to Manual: </span><a href="https://docs.google.com/document/d/1Da2PcJZ_pCLqTdQIiUTECN5tYshVaQdA84Vr9WSNiOk/edit#heading=h.7yewl7f6d2fn" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"><span style="text-decoration: underline">https://docs.google.com/document/d/1Da2PcJZ_pCLqTdQIiUTECN5tYshVaQdA84Vr9WSNiOk/edit#heading=h.7yewl7f6d2fn</span></a><span style="text-decoration: none"> </span></p>

data.name: Configure Development Environment
data.body: <p><span style="text-decoration: underline">Task Description</span></p> <p><span style="text-decoration: underline">When to open this task</span><span style="text-decoration: none">: </span></p> <ul> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">AFTER we have full access to the site (hosting &amp; CMS) </span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">BEFORE doing any dev work on the site</span></p> </li> </ul> <p><span style="text-decoration: none"><br /></span><span style="text-decoration: underline">Goal:</span><span style="text-decoration: none"> </span><span style="text-decoration: none"><br /></span><span style="text-decoration: none">Create a development environment using a copy of their existing site where the website changes &amp; fixes can be tested before moving to the production (live) environment.</span><strong><br /></strong></p> <p> </p> <p><span style="text-decoration: underline">Instructions:</span></p> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">ON PM: </span></p> <ol> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Before assigning this task to Frontend Team, please provide the following:</span></p> <ol> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Provide URL of live domain</span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Specify which CMS it is (i.e. Custom backend, WP, WP+Woocommerce, Magento1, Magento2, etc.) </span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">As we are copying the existing live site on the dev environment, make sure the site access is in the workbook before assigning this task.</span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Inform FED if the client has their own developers so that Collaboration Flow information can be documented internally. </span></p> </li> </ol> </li> </ol> <p><strong> </strong></p> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">On Frontend Dev: </span><span style="text-decoration: none"><br /></span><span style="text-decoration: none"><br /></span><span style="text-decoration: none">If the client is on Wordpress: </span></p> <ol> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Create SmartWebsiteDesign.com Subdomain URL &amp; cPanel </span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Create Git Repo </span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Make sure the dev site  is blocked via robots.txt &amp; is not being tracked with GA.</span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Comment accordingly with the deliverables, and add it to the Workbook [Logins] tab </span></p> <ol> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Disable Pro/Premium plugins on our dev site. </span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Reactivate the Pro &amp; Premium plugins with the proper licensing</span></p> <ol> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">For plugins where Smartsites has unlimited licenses or licenses that can be used for clients  (eg. Gravity form, WP Rocket etc.) please use this license for the dev site </span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">If sharable licenses are not available, please request for the PM/client to provide the plugin licensing details. The client may need to purchase additional licenses to use on the dev site. </span></p> </li> </ol> </li> </ol> </li> </ol> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Note: The purpose of the dev site is to test changes on an environment which is as similar to the client’s live site as possible. Missing plugins licenses may cause inaccuracies in testing, so we strongly advise to address all licensing issues ASAP. </span></p> <p><span style="text-decoration: none"> </span></p> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">If the client is on another CMS: </span></p> <ol> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Follow the CMS-specific guide </span><a href="https://docs.google.com/document/d/16Z8LoUr6jhyHTDkQ9LQfxlIB65J6RlMJ3QWhhTezkvo/edit?tab=t.0" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"><span style="text-decoration: underline">here</span></a><span style="text-decoration: none">. </span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">If the client’s CMS is not already represented in the guide, please research solutions and discuss with the PM. Once a solution is decided, add the procedure to the guide for future reference. </span><span style="text-decoration: none"><br /></span><span style="text-decoration: none"><br /><br /></span></p> </li> </ol> <p><span style="text-decoration: underline">When to Close: </span><span style="text-decoration: underline"><br /></span><span style="text-decoration: none">When development environment is created and logged in the workbook</span></p> <p><span style="text-decoration: underline"><br /></span><span style="text-decoration: underline">Link to Manual: </span><a href="https://docs.google.com/document/d/1Da2PcJZ_pCLqTdQIiUTECN5tYshVaQdA84Vr9WSNiOk/edit#heading=h.7yewl7f6d2fn" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"><span style="text-decoration: underline">https://docs.google.com/document/d/1Da2PcJZ_pCLqTdQIiUTECN5tYshVaQdA84Vr9WSNiOk/edit#heading=h.7yewl7f6d2fn</span></a><span style="text-decoration: none"> </span></p>

data.body: <p>Homepage </p> <p> </p> <ul> <li>When the client clicks "Start Planning" under "Lets create memories that last a lifetime" is should lead to the Contact Us page <a href="https://newjonathanstrav.smartwebsitedesign.com/contact-us/" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">HERE</a></li> <li>Each "Get Started" or "Learn More" button should lead to the clients 'Contact Us' page <a href="https://newjonathanstrav.smartwebsitedesign.com/contact-us/" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">HERE</a></li> <li>Please replace the lorem ipsum text with what is shown here " From a weekend escape to a global journey, Jonathan’s Travels curates unforgettable experiences with VIP treatment and exclusive access at every stop. Travel the world with distinction."</li> <li> <div class="rich_text_inline_image_wrapper"><img src="/proxy.php?proxy=forward_thumbnail&module=system&invalidate=aa84d14bc5afe7a0b2b62ad010d476eb151ac7dd&context=upload&name=2025-03%2F146809-QgKHgpc9r17vsNAquIiI1RfFff7FIaWIPbMaYIxn&original_file_name=image.png&width=500&height=300&ver=171988&scale=scale&crop=1" alt="image.png" image-type="attachment" object-id="256105" /></div> </li> <li>Please move the Destinations subpage and drop down menu to the Top Navigation Bar (so it should be ( Home, About, Destinations (Dropdown to Countries), Our Services (Dropdown to Services, Blog, Contact Us, )<br /> <div class="rich_text_inline_image_wrapper"><img src="/proxy.php?proxy=forward_thumbnail&module=system&invalidate=aa84d14bc5afe7a0b2b62ad010d476eb151ac7dd&context=upload&name=2025-03%2F146809-Q65BGPP86as2i8CAsIzPVae7CJIhbR0924GHCpGF&original_file_name=image.png&width=500&height=300&ver=750863&scale=scale&crop=1" alt="image.png" image-type="attachment" object-id="256106" /></div> </li> <li>Remove drop to blogs under "Blogs" </li> <li><img src="/proxy.php?proxy=forward_thumbnail&module=system&invalidate=aa84d14bc5afe7a0b2b62ad010d476eb151ac7dd&context=upload&name=2025-03%2F146809-EwvgO4qZmeVD9ToqYrGSEezc39Aiu7VNyNNjsOPe&original_file_name=image.png&width=500&height=300&ver=785108&scale=scale&crop=1" alt="image.png" image-type="attachment" object-id="256107" /></li> <li>For the About Us Page where it says "Get Started" it should take the client to the "Contact Us" Page</li> <li>Each Destination Page in the menu where you scroll should take the client to the respective Destination Page as per Column AE rows 12-19 of the clients <a href="https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/15T2AF8br69vD2cYoPn0ktPwGIX_5M3Alt1qURWqpMzM/edit?gid=406948056#gid=406948056" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">Website Plan </a>. Each section as shown here should say 'Start Planning Your Next Adventure"</li> <li> <div class="rich_text_inline_image_wrapper"><img src="/proxy.php?proxy=forward_thumbnail&module=system&invalidate=aa84d14bc5afe7a0b2b62ad010d476eb151ac7dd&context=upload&name=2025-03%2F146809-TNTU1vQGExp9JV2wnI0GwFMQKnwIX0yN2aImBED7&original_file_name=image.png&width=500&height=300&ver=9332&scale=scale&crop=1" alt="image.png" image-type="attachment" object-id="256108" /></div> </li> <li>When you hover over each country pin it should take you to the respective Destination page as per Column AE rows 12-19 of the clients <a href="https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/15T2AF8br69vD2cYoPn0ktPwGIX_5M3Alt1qURWqpMzM/edit?gid=406948056#gid=406948056" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">Website Plan</a>. Please ensure each continent matches according to a real world map </li> </ul>

data.name: Reducing Duration of Videos to Increase Load Time?
data.body: <p><span class="mention mention-user">Frontend Dev Team</span> </p> <p> </p> <p>The client stated in this doc that the videos that are on her website are very pixelated and was wondering if we reduce the length of the videos, would that help with fast load times?  </p> <p> </p> <p><a href="https://docs.google.com/document/d/1P7IFsFGlZluarKgFhNDYqmt1QtLNpaAg/edit" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">Final Website changes as of 0202.docx - Google Docs</a></p>

Thank you!</p>

data.body: <strong>Goal: </strong>Create a backup in case something goes wrong + something we use to create test environment for development.<br /><br /> <p><strong>Checklist:</strong></p> <ol> <li>Add as a backup-original.zip to GDrive</li> </ol> <br /><strong>ON PM:</strong><br />Provide logins to current website for frontend dev team to create a safety backup.

data.name: Titles, H1s &amp; Meta Descriptions
data.body: <p><strong><span style="text-decoration: underline">When to open this task:</span><span style="text-decoration: none">  </span></strong></p> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">AFTER the Website Plan has been completed [see important considerations]  </span><span style="text-decoration: none"><br /><br /></span></p> <p><strong><span style="text-decoration: underline">Goal</span></strong><span style="text-decoration: none"><strong>:</strong> </span><span style="text-decoration: none"><br /></span><span style="text-decoration: none">Fill in onsite SEO for approved Website Plan. This should include:</span></p> <ul> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Target Keyword: filled for non-Company pages. Otherwise, “N/A”.</span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Header, Titles &amp; URLs &amp; Meta descriptions filled in for all of the pages</span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Features Target Keyword whenever applicable </span></p> </li> </ul> <p><strong> </strong></p> <p><strong><span style="text-decoration: underline">Important Considerations: </span></strong></p> <ol> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">This is by far &amp; away the most important task in our SEO process. </span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">This deliverable can be overwhelming for clients to review/approve. If the client has over 40 pages to check, consider:</span></p> <ul> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Breaking it down into specific rows/groups of pages to have client review in order of importance. </span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Moving Onsite SEO to a separate spreadsheet to isolate/hide the extra distracting columns. </span></p> </li> </ul> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">To avoid delay opening this task, you can begin with only “existing pages” or only batches of pages which have been approved by client. </span><span style="text-decoration: none">It is better to write &amp; implement 10 pages than write but not implement 1000. </span></p> </li> </ol> <p><span style="text-decoration: none"><br /></span><strong><span style="text-decoration: underline">Instructions: </span><span style="text-decoration: none"> </span></strong><span style="text-decoration: none"><br /><br /></span></p> <p><strong><span style="text-decoration: none">On <span class="mention mention-user">Inbound Marketing Team</span>  [1/2]: </span></strong></p> <ol> <li><span style="text-decoration: none">Enter the list of all indexable pages along with their current onsite SEO in the website plan tab.</span> <ul> <li><span style="text-decoration: none">URL, Target Keyword (SV + KWD), Additional Keywords, Old H1 , Old Title, Old Metas</span></li> </ul> </li> <li><span style="text-decoration: none">Confirm all pages are listed in the website plan and organized per our template structure</span><span style="text-decoration: none">. </span></li> <li><span style="text-decoration: none">Highlight any cells where Titles, H1s &amp; Meta descriptions are indicated as missing, duplicate or long in the Technical Audit. (G43-G45)</span></li> <li>Write New Headers and Titles. If the existing headers and titles include the optimized target keywords, are relevant, and follow SEO best practices, there is no need to re-write. Simply write “keep” in the “New” column. <ul> <li>Reassign to Content Team to check/write meta descriptions.</li> </ul> </li> </ol> <br /> <p><strong><span style="text-decoration: none">On  <span class="mention mention-user">Content Team</span>:</span></strong></p> <ol> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Proofread headers &amp; titles for grammar/syntax, and rewrite as needed.</span><span style="text-decoration: none">  </span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Review the existing meta descriptions. If they include the indicated target keywords, are relevant and </span><a href="https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1ZSQ5NbFo_cG4cXzPIKnurIAo71jBR6jFUcrz9iYREw4/edit?gid=2006941339#gid=2006941339" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"><span style="text-decoration: underline">follow SEO best practices</span></a><span style="text-decoration: none">, there is no need to re-write, simply write “keep” in the “New Meta Description” column. </span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">If it needs to be written or re-written, please write meta descriptions, including the target keyword.</span></p> </li> </ol> <p><span style="text-decoration: none"> </span></p> <p><strong><span style="text-decoration: none">On PM [1/2]:</span></strong></p> <ol> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Please review and share with the client. [See important considerations &amp;<a href="https://docs.google.com/document/d/1xxp9t8Z80MM5Slq7jHPaXc1fsEylaRDOPlv_ykPowNg/edit" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"> email template</a>]</span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">After getting approval, please re-assign to FED to implement.</span></p> </li> </ol> <strong><span style="text-decoration: none"><br />On <span class="mention mention-user">Frontend Dev Team</span> </span></strong><br /> <ol> <li>Please implement approved Titles, H1s &amp; Meta Descriptions, ensuring that this does not impact other website elements like site navigation.  <ul> <li>Target keyword</li> <li>Title</li> <li>Header</li> <li>Meta description</li> </ul> </li> </ol> <br /><strong><span style="text-decoration: none">On <span class="mention mention-user">Inbound Marketing Team</span> [2/2]:<br /></span></strong> <ol> <li>Please confirm proper implementation of Titles, H1s &amp; Meta Descriptions by pulling missing/duplicate/ titles, headers, and meta description data from Screaming Frog. <ul> <li>Issues regarding ‘noindex’ pages or pages otherwise unimportant for SEO (eg. paginated pages, legal/admin pages, etc.) can be ignored.</li> <li>If any issues appear in the crawl but data is not available in the workbook, please request it from the PM. </li> </ul> </li> </ol> <p><strong> </strong></p> <p><strong>On PM [2/2]: </strong></p> <ol> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">If all Titles, H1s &amp; Meta Descriptions has been implemented, proceed to close the task. </span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">If we only completed the first batch or ScreamingFrog still shows issues, repeat writing, approval, and implementation as needed until all descriptions are published. </span></p> </li> </ol> <p><strong> </strong></p> <p><strong><span style="text-decoration: underline">When to Close:</span></strong><span style="text-decoration: none"> </span><span style="text-decoration: none"><br /></span><span style="text-decoration: none">Once all optimized H1s, Titles &amp; Meta descriptions have been implemented &amp; Screaming Frog confirms no Onsite SEO issues on </span><span style="text-decoration: none"><strong>indexable</strong> </span><span style="text-decoration: none">pages. </span></p> <p><span style="text-decoration: none"> </span></p> <p><span style="text-decoration: underline"><strong>Link to Manual:</strong></span> <a href="https://docs.google.com/document/d/1Da2PcJZ_pCLqTdQIiUTECN5tYshVaQdA84Vr9WSNiOk/edit#heading=h.10gdsc5qm8im" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">https://docs.google.com/document/d/1Da2PcJZ_pCLqTdQIiUTECN5tYshVaQdA84Vr9WSNiOk/edit#heading=h.10gdsc5qm8im</a></p>

data.name: AccessiBe Implementation
data.body: <p>Hi <span class="mention mention-user">Frontend Dev Team</span> <br /><br />Client has purchased the AccessiBe plugin and is asking for us to implement. Instructions below:<br /><br /></p> <p><span>NavaDerm Partners LLC has sent you instructions for installing accessWidget. For best results, paste the installation code we provided into your webpage’s HTML, right before the closing body tag.</span></p> <p><span> </span></p> <p><span>‘&lt;/body&gt;’</span></p> <p><span> </span></p> <p><span>We’ve put together installation guides for popular site builders like WordPress and Shopify.</span></p> <p><span> </span></p> <p><span>&lt;script&gt; (function(){ var s = document.createElement('script'); var h = document.querySelector('head') || document.body; s.src = '<a href="https://acsbapp.com/apps/app/dist/js/app.js" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">https://acsbapp.com/apps/app/dist/js/app.js</a>'; s.async = true; s.onload = function(){ acsbJS.init(); }; h.appendChild(s); })(); &lt;/script&gt;</span></p> <p> </p>

Missing plugins licenses may cause inaccuracies in testing, so we strongly advise to address all licensing issues ASAP. </span></p> <p><span style="text-decoration: none"> </span></p> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">If the client is on another CMS: </span></p> <ol> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Follow the CMS-specific guide </span><a href="https://docs.google.com/document/d/16Z8LoUr6jhyHTDkQ9LQfxlIB65J6RlMJ3QWhhTezkvo/edit?tab=t.0" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"><span style="text-decoration: underline">here</span></a><span style="text-decoration: none">. </span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">If the client’s CMS is not already represented in the guide, please research solutions and discuss with the PM. Once a solution is decided, add the procedure to the guide for future reference. </span><span style="text-decoration: none"><br /></span><span style="text-decoration: none"><br /><br /></span></p> </li> </ol> <p><span style="text-decoration: underline">When to Close: </span><span style="text-decoration: underline"><br /></span><span style="text-decoration: none">When development environment is created and logged in the workbook</span></p> <p><span style="text-decoration: underline"><br /></span><span style="text-decoration: underline">Link to Manual: </span><a href="https://docs.google.com/document/d/1Da2PcJZ_pCLqTdQIiUTECN5tYshVaQdA84Vr9WSNiOk/edit#heading=h.7yewl7f6d2fn" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"><span style="text-decoration: underline">https://docs.google.com/document/d/1Da2PcJZ_pCLqTdQIiUTECN5tYshVaQdA84Vr9WSNiOk/edit#heading=h.7yewl7f6d2fn</span></a><span style="text-decoration: none"> </span></p>

data.name: Configure Development Environment
data.body: <p><span style="text-decoration: underline">Task Description</span></p> <p><span style="text-decoration: underline">When to open this task</span><span style="text-decoration: none">: </span></p> <ul> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">AFTER we have full access to the site (hosting &amp; CMS) </span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">BEFORE doing any dev work on the site</span></p> </li> </ul> <p><span style="text-decoration: none"><br /></span><span style="text-decoration: underline">Goal:</span><span style="text-decoration: none"> </span><span style="text-decoration: none"><br /></span><span style="text-decoration: none">Create a development environment using a copy of their existing site where the website changes &amp; fixes can be tested before moving to the production (live) environment.</span><strong><br /></strong></p> <p> </p> <p><span style="text-decoration: underline">Instructions:</span></p> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">ON PM: </span></p> <ol> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Before assigning this task to Frontend Team, please provide the following:</span></p> <ol> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Provide URL of live domain</span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Specify which CMS it is (i.e. Custom backend, WP, WP+Woocommerce, Magento1, Magento2, etc.) </span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">As we are copying the existing live site on the dev environment, make sure the site access is in the workbook before assigning this task.</span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Inform FED if the client has their own developers so that Collaboration Flow information can be documented internally. </span></p> </li> </ol> </li> </ol> <p><strong> </strong></p> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">On Frontend Dev: </span><span style="text-decoration: none"><br /></span><span style="text-decoration: none"><br /></span><span style="text-decoration: none">If the client is on Wordpress: </span></p> <ol> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Create SmartWebsiteDesign.com Subdomain URL &amp; cPanel </span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Create Git Repo </span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Make sure the dev site  is blocked via robots.txt &amp; is not being tracked with GA.</span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Comment accordingly with the deliverables, and add it to the Workbook [Logins] tab </span></p> <ol> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Disable Pro/Premium plugins on our dev site. </span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Reactivate the Pro &amp; Premium plugins with the proper licensing</span></p> <ol> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">For plugins where Smartsites has unlimited licenses or licenses that can be used for clients  (eg. Gravity form, WP Rocket etc.) please use this license for the dev site </span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">If sharable licenses are not available, please request for the PM/client to provide the plugin licensing details. The client may need to purchase additional licenses to use on the dev site. </span></p> </li> </ol> </li> </ol> </li> </ol> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Note: The purpose of the dev site is to test changes on an environment which is as similar to the client’s live site as possible. Missing plugins licenses may cause inaccuracies in testing, so we strongly advise to address all licensing issues ASAP. </span></p> <p><span style="text-decoration: none"> </span></p> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">If the client is on another CMS: </span></p> <ol> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Follow the CMS-specific guide </span><a href="https://docs.google.com/document/d/16Z8LoUr6jhyHTDkQ9LQfxlIB65J6RlMJ3QWhhTezkvo/edit?tab=t.0" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"><span style="text-decoration: underline">here</span></a><span style="text-decoration: none">. </span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">If the client’s CMS is not already represented in the guide, please research solutions and discuss with the PM. Once a solution is decided, add the procedure to the guide for future reference. </span><span style="text-decoration: none"><br /></span><span style="text-decoration: none"><br /><br /></span></p> </li> </ol> <p><span style="text-decoration: underline">When to Close: </span><span style="text-decoration: underline"><br /></span><span style="text-decoration: none">When development environment is created and logged in the workbook</span></p> <p><span style="text-decoration: underline"><br /></span><span style="text-decoration: underline">Link to Manual: </span><a href="https://docs.google.com/document/d/1Da2PcJZ_pCLqTdQIiUTECN5tYshVaQdA84Vr9WSNiOk/edit#heading=h.7yewl7f6d2fn" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"><span style="text-decoration: underline">https://docs.google.com/document/d/1Da2PcJZ_pCLqTdQIiUTECN5tYshVaQdA84Vr9WSNiOk/edit#heading=h.7yewl7f6d2fn</span></a><span style="text-decoration: none"> </span></p>

data.name: Titles, H1s &amp; Meta Descriptions
data.body: <p><strong><span style="text-decoration: underline">When to open this task:</span><span style="text-decoration: none">  </span></strong></p> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">AFTER the Website Plan has been completed [see important considerations]  </span><span style="text-decoration: none"><br /><br /></span></p> <p><strong><span style="text-decoration: underline">Goal</span></strong><span style="text-decoration: none"><strong>:</strong> </span><span style="text-decoration: none"><br /></span><span style="text-decoration: none">Fill in onsite SEO for approved Website Plan. This should include:</span></p> <ul> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Target Keyword: filled for non-Company pages. Otherwise, “N/A”.</span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Header, Titles &amp; URLs &amp; Meta descriptions filled in for all of the pages</span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Features Target Keyword whenever applicable </span></p> </li> </ul> <p><strong> </strong></p> <p><strong><span style="text-decoration: underline">Important Considerations: </span></strong></p> <ol> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">This is by far &amp; away the most important task in our SEO process. </span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">This deliverable can be overwhelming for clients to review/approve. If the client has over 40 pages to check, consider:</span></p> <ul> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Breaking it down into specific rows/groups of pages to have client review in order of importance. </span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Moving Onsite SEO to a separate spreadsheet to isolate/hide the extra distracting columns. </span></p> </li> </ul> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">To avoid delay opening this task, you can begin with only “existing pages” or only batches of pages which have been approved by client. </span><span style="text-decoration: none">It is better to write &amp; implement 10 pages than write but not implement 1000. </span></p> </li> </ol> <p><span style="text-decoration: none"><br /></span><strong><span style="text-decoration: underline">Instructions: </span><span style="text-decoration: none"> </span></strong><span style="text-decoration: none"><br /><br /></span></p> <p><strong><span style="text-decoration: none">On <span class="mention mention-user">Inbound Marketing Team</span>  [1/2]: </span></strong></p> <ol> <li><span style="text-decoration: none">Enter the list of all indexable pages along with their current onsite SEO in the website plan tab.</span> <ul> <li><span style="text-decoration: none">URL, Target Keyword (SV + KWD), Additional Keywords, Old H1 , Old Title, Old Metas</span></li> </ul> </li> <li><span style="text-decoration: none">Confirm all pages are listed in the website plan and organized per our template structure</span><span style="text-decoration: none">. </span></li> <li><span style="text-decoration: none">Highlight any cells where Titles, H1s &amp; Meta descriptions are indicated as missing, duplicate or long in the Technical Audit. (G43-G45)</span></li> <li>Write New Headers and Titles. If the existing headers and titles include the optimized target keywords, are relevant, and follow SEO best practices, there is no need to re-write. Simply write “keep” in the “New” column. <ul> <li>Reassign to Content Team to check/write meta descriptions.</li> </ul> </li> </ol> <br /> <p><strong><span style="text-decoration: none">On  <span class="mention mention-user">Content Team</span>:</span></strong></p> <ol> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Proofread headers &amp; titles for grammar/syntax, and rewrite as needed.</span><span style="text-decoration: none">  </span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Review the existing meta descriptions. If they include the indicated target keywords, are relevant and </span><a href="https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1ZSQ5NbFo_cG4cXzPIKnurIAo71jBR6jFUcrz9iYREw4/edit?gid=2006941339#gid=2006941339" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"><span style="text-decoration: underline">follow SEO best practices</span></a><span style="text-decoration: none">, there is no need to re-write, simply write “keep” in the “New Meta Description” column. </span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">If it needs to be written or re-written, please write meta descriptions, including the target keyword.</span></p> </li> </ol> <p><span style="text-decoration: none"> </span></p> <p><strong><span style="text-decoration: none">On PM [1/2]:</span></strong></p> <ol> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Please review and share with the client. [See important considerations &amp;<a href="https://docs.google.com/document/d/1xxp9t8Z80MM5Slq7jHPaXc1fsEylaRDOPlv_ykPowNg/edit" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"> email template</a>]</span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">After getting approval, please re-assign to FED to implement.</span></p> </li> </ol> <strong><span style="text-decoration: none"><br />On <span class="mention mention-user">Frontend Dev Team</span> </span></strong><br /> <ol> <li>Please implement approved Titles, H1s &amp; Meta Descriptions, ensuring that this does not impact other website elements like site navigation.  <ul> <li>Target keyword</li> <li>Title</li> <li>Header</li> <li>Meta description</li> </ul> </li> </ol> <br /><strong><span style="text-decoration: none">On <span class="mention mention-user">Inbound Marketing Team</span> [2/2]:<br /></span></strong> <ol> <li>Please confirm proper implementation of Titles, H1s &amp; Meta Descriptions by pulling missing/duplicate/ titles, headers, and meta description data from Screaming Frog. <ul> <li>Issues regarding ‘noindex’ pages or pages otherwise unimportant for SEO (eg. paginated pages, legal/admin pages, etc.) can be ignored.</li> <li>If any issues appear in the crawl but data is not available in the workbook, please request it from the PM. </li> </ul> </li> </ol> <p><strong> </strong></p> <p><strong>On PM [2/2]: </strong></p> <ol> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">If all Titles, H1s &amp; Meta Descriptions has been implemented, proceed to close the task. </span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">If we only completed the first batch or ScreamingFrog still shows issues, repeat writing, approval, and implementation as needed until all descriptions are published. </span></p> </li> </ol> <p><strong> </strong></p> <p><strong><span style="text-decoration: underline">When to Close:</span></strong><span style="text-decoration: none"> </span><span style="text-decoration: none"><br /></span><span style="text-decoration: none">Once all optimized H1s, Titles &amp; Meta descriptions have been implemented &amp; Screaming Frog confirms no Onsite SEO issues on </span><span style="text-decoration: none"><strong>indexable</strong> </span><span style="text-decoration: none">pages. </span></p> <p><span style="text-decoration: none"> </span></p> <p><span style="text-decoration: underline"><strong>Link to Manual:</strong></span> <a href="https://docs.google.com/document/d/1Da2PcJZ_pCLqTdQIiUTECN5tYshVaQdA84Vr9WSNiOk/edit#heading=h.10gdsc5qm8im" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">https://docs.google.com/document/d/1Da2PcJZ_pCLqTdQIiUTECN5tYshVaQdA84Vr9WSNiOk/edit#heading=h.10gdsc5qm8im</a></p>

data.name: Create a page for &quot;Expanding Our Reach&quot;
data.body: <p>Hi <span class="mention mention-user">Frontend Dev Team</span> hope you're well!</p> <p> </p> <p>Client asked if you can clone one of the "areas we serve" pages and for the H1 it can be "<span>Oregon and Idaho" (instead of "Bellevue" for example)</span></p> <p> </p> <p><span>The content in this section: <a href="https://tinyurl.com/27mbrshf" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">https://tinyurl.com/27mbrshf</a></span></p> <p><span>could just say "Hair Oh Yeah is proud to expand our reach to patients in Oregon and Idaho"</span></p> <p> </p> <p><span>and the content in this section: <a href="https://tinyurl.com/2atdf2dd" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">https://tinyurl.com/2atdf2dd</a></span></p> <p> </p> <p><span>can say:</span></p> <p><strong>Serving Patients and Customers Nationwide: Expanding Our Reach to Oregon and Idaho</strong></p> <p>At Hair Oh Yeah, we are proud to serve not only our local community but also patients across the United States. Over the years, we have built a reputation for providing top-quality products and services for non-invasive hair restoration, and our reach has grown beyond our home state.</p> <p><strong>Serving Patients from Oregon and Idaho</strong></p> <p>We are excited to share that our exceptional products and services have attracted patients and customers from neighboring states, including Oregon and Idaho. Whether it's for specialized hair loss treatments or the purchase of our premium serums or at-home kits, we have been privileged to support individuals from these regions in achieving their wellness and beauty goals.</p> <p>Our commitment to delivering high-quality service extends across state lines, ensuring that those who need our assistance can access the care and products they deserve, no matter where they are located. We make it easy for patients from Oregon and Idaho to avail of our services and purchase our offerings through seamless personalized care.</p> <p><strong>Why Choose Us?</strong></p> <ul> <li><strong>Expertise</strong>: Our team is dedicated to providing the best care and guidance to patients from all over the country.</li> <li><strong>Quality Products</strong>: From scalp health and wellness products to specialized treatments, we ensure that our offerings meet the highest standards of quality.</li> <li><strong>Convenience</strong>: With our streamlined consultation services, patients from surrounding states can enjoy hassle-free access to everything we offer.</li> </ul> <p> </p> <p>We are proud to be a trusted resource for individuals in Washington, Oregon, Idaho, and beyond, and we look forward to continuing to serve our patients!</p> <p> </p> <p>you can add navigation under the "aeras we serve" item on the nav bar. This can be done directly on live since we already have the existing page template and client has approved the content. Thank you!</p> <p> </p>
